pages.name: Main
pages.data:
css
[Welcome to the official GCP webserver for web browser services]

   [!1] Type "goto /MAIN/COMHELP" to learn how to use your web browsing software.

   [!2] Type "goto NX.INDEX" to start surfing the galactic internet.

pages.name: Command Help
pages.data:
css
   Using your standardized internet browsing software, you can look at information from any planet in the Galactic Confederation of Planets (GCP).

   There are two primary commands that your terminal understands that can help you navigate the web.

   1. The "Link" command:
      Whenever you see a box with an exclamation point in it (marked in orange), it means that it's a "link" to another page on the web. Take [!1 this link], for example, you can go to it by typing an exclaimation point with the number in the box next to it. You try, type "!1".

   2. The "Goto" command:
      To go directly to a webpage without a link, type "goto [PATH]" with the [PATH] being an address for a site or page. For example, typing "goto NX.HELP:/MAIN" would take you to the page called "MAIN" on the "NX.HELP" website.

pages.name: Error 2
pages.data:
css
Error #2: Page not found.
Type "back" to go back to the [!1] homepage.

pages.name: Command One
pages.data:
css
   Congratulations, you properly used the '!' command!

   Type "back" to return to the page you were on previously. This works on all websites.

pages.name: Main
pages.data:
css
[Welcome to the official GCP webserver for web browser services]

    We have detected that your newly-internet-connected computer has mouse/pointer input hardware.  This means that, while browsing the galactic internet, you can "click" on websites to interact with them!

    To learn how to use your internet browsing software, click [!1 the orange text right here].

    If you already know how to use your browsing software, [!2 click here] to head to "NX.INDEX" and see domain listings.

pages.name: Tutorial
pages.data:
css
    Congratulations! You just "clicked a link".  Using links is the easiest way to get around the Galactic Internet.  If you see a link, which is [orange text in a box], you can 'click' it by moving your pointer/mouse over it and clicking.  For example, you can follow [!1 this link] by clicking it.  Go ahead, try it!

    You can also enter commands using your keyboard.  By pressing the [TAB] key on the left side of your terminal's keyboard, or by clicking the white text box at the bottom of your screen, you can type direct commands to your web browser!  An important command is the "goto" command, used to go to a specific page or webserver.  For example, type "goto /TEST" to go to a page on this website called "TEST".  Go on, you try it!

pages.name: You did it!
pages.data:
css
    You did it! You just followed a link!  Now, you can type "back", or click the [<- back] button in the top left of your screen to go back to the page you were viewing previously.  This works on all webservers.

pages.name: Text
pages.data:
css
    You did it, you just used a "goto" command!  Now, go [back] to the page you were on previously.

pages.name: Help
pages.data:
css
   Netpedia's information is spread over many, many files. And these files are spread over countless folders. While browsing Netpedia, note that if a title has a '>' character preceeding the name, it's a folder, if it has a '+', it's a file containing readable information.

css
    [!1] +Deorian Race
    [!2] +Ricefieldic Deorians

pages.name: Deorian
pages.data:
css
┌─────────────────────────────────┐
│Group Name.........:Party        │
│Youngling Name.....:Bet          │
│Status.............:Safe         │ 
│Vivotype...........:Daerus       │
│Archetype..........:Humanoid     │
│Domestication......:N/A          │
│Intelligence Class.:Sentient     │
│Lifespan...........:31±10.3 Years│
│Time to Maturity...:9±1.73 Years │
│# Physical Sexes...:2            │
│Sexual Polymorphism:Moderate     │
│Procreation Method.:Interactive  │ 
│Diet/Resource Input:Biovorus     │
│Respiratory Gas....:Oxygen       │
│Weight.............:79±11Kg      │
│Height.............:161±21cm     │
│Thermal Range......:304±22°k     │
│Blood Volume.......:6L           │
│Min Conscious Blood:5L           │
│Top Speed..........:18m/s        │
└─────────────────────────────────┘

    The Deorians are a notable, numerous species, spanning many planets and star systems.  The Deorian specimen is bipedal, with B-Type bodies.  Deorians are covered in body fur, with colors ranging from crimson to cyan (fur color is determined by genetic factors).  In addition to their body fur, Deorians have longer hairs growing from their heads and tailbones, giving the appearance of common hair and tails.  The color of these longer hairs are typically a darker shade of their body fur tone.  These hairs are thicker and longer than the hairs of their body fur.  Deorian tails consist of no flesh or bone, simply being a long bundle of hairs stemming from their lowermost parts of their backs.�css
    Like all known species of human, Deorians heavily rely on unique facial structures to identify others.  Compared to other species, the face of a Deorian is notably unique.  Like other life of the [!1 Daerus] vivotype, the eyes of the Deorian face are notably large.  While the average diameter of other humans' eyes is two to three centimeters, the adult Deorian eye is five to six centimeters.  Regardless its size, the Deorian eye has a unique appearance.  The Sclera of a Deorian's eyes are light grey, but gradually turn dark brown as they age.  The iris color of of the eye can come in about a dozen different, shimmering colors, mostly determined by the ethnicity of the subject.  Most notably, a Deorian's pupil is shaped like a rounded triangle.  The rotation of each eye (meaning the rotation of the triangular pupil) is apparently completely random, determined at conception; even genetically-identical twins are born with different pupil orientations.
    As for the rest of the face, the mouth and nose are built into a short snout, which is about half the height and width of the face as a whole.  The snout extends four to six centimeters out from the rest of the face, making a sort of muzzle.�css
    In terms of their overall bodies, Deorians have typical B-Type frames.  Deorians' limbs are of average width and girth, but the muscle bundles are more defined under the skin.  Some scientists think that this detail is due to Deorians coming from a world of moderately-high gravity (1.62 G).  Being of B-Type bodies, their legs have two major joints (as opposed to one); the first one is the forward-facing upper knee, which is just "the knee" in F-Type bodies, and the backward-facing lower knee, which is a variant of "the ankle" seen in F-Type bodies.  Overall, this divides the leg into three, equal-height sections.  From a side view, the upper-most third of the leg is quite wide, spanning 35 to 43 centimeters front to back (as it's full of muscle), while the lower-most third (right above the foot) is comparatively thin, only about 10 centimeters in diameter.

    Deorians' hands and feet are hoof-like, being made of hard, enamel-like bone.  Deorian hands consist of four free-moving cloves, all of which being opposable, functionally making them relatively undexterous, though unusually powerful, fingers.  All four fingers of an adult Deorian are seven to nine centimeters long.  On average, a Deorian has 600 to 700 newtons of grip strength in each hand.
    Deorians' feet are structured similarly to their hands.In the foot, three of the cloves extend forward from the "ankle" by about 20 centimeters, while the fourth faces backwards to act as a heel.  The clove of the foot which acts as the heel is much wider than the three in front.  Unlike those of the hand, the three cloves making up the fronts of the feet are fused together at the bases.  This makes the foot much stronger, though less dexterous.�css
    On the tops of their heads, each Deorian has a pair of natural antlers. At birth, these antlers are little more than nubs.  Though these antlers start to grow beginning in adolescence (five to ten [!2 Galactic Years]), and thereafter grow continually until death.  The patterns and shapes of the antlers vary from person to person, predetermined by one's sex, age, and ethnicity.  Tests show that Deorians are genetically coded to connect human identities to antler patterns in the same way they perceive hair.  The antlers of Deorian males can grow to rise between 15 to 50 centimeters above their head, while females' can grow up to 70.  Many Deorians shave down or even shear off their antlers for cultural reasons, convenience, personal choice, or aesthetics.
    
    The Deorian species has only moderate sexual polymorphism.  Most notably, female Deorians are, on average, 18 centimeters shorter than males of the same species, 145 to 154 centimeters on average, while males stand at 168 to 177 centimeters.  Conversely, the antlers of a common female Deorian tend to be about 20 centimeters taller than that of a common male.
    For reproductive reasons, females' waists are slightly wider.  This difference is mostly imperceptible to other human species, but Deorian brains are built to be better at recognizing the difference.  While Deorian males have a shoulders-to-waist ratio of about 7:6, females have a ratio closer to 1:1.  Finally, male snouts extend six centimeters out from the rest of the face, while female snouts only extend four centimeters out on average.

    The Deorians, as a species, have been quite successful.  They are the dominant species on their homeworld of [!3 Deoria], and have traversed endless space to propagate their kind across the stars.

pages.name: Ricefieldic Deorians
pages.data:
css
   Most Deorians who are native to the home planet [!1 Deoria], especially those who are native to or can be ethnically traced to the [!2 Ricefield continent of Deoria], are about 167m (5.48 feet) tall on average. They are known to be rather muscular, and tend to come in vibrant, yet complimentary, colors.
   Deorians have a reputation for being intelligent and taking control. These opinions are likely due to the nation`s advancements in genetic engineering, and its current place as the leader of the [!3 Galactic Confederation of Planets].

pages.name: Ghillymedic Deorian
pages.data:
css
   Ghillymedic Deorians, born to the lunar nation of [!1 Ghillymede], are typically 180cm (5.8 feet) of height. Ghillymedic Deorians are much more faded in color compared to their native counterparts(though more agile), as well as slightly less muscular(Due to the lower gravity of the territories.)
Ghillymedics are seen as small, and to some even insignifigant, due to the nation's mininscule size. Ghillymedic individuals are commonly very self-driven, but they occasionally overestimate their abilities.

pages.name: Servuses
pages.data:
css
 [!1] +Servus Race
 [!2] +Laborer Servus
 [!3] +Shiner Servus
 [!4] +Steward Servus

pages.name: Servuses
pages.data:
css
   Servuses are selectively-bred, genetically-modified [!1 Deorians], standing at exactly 155cm (5.1 feet) tall. Servuses were designed in the year 55 by the company [!2 Transition Genetics] for the purpose of creating general use automation. Servuses are genetically predisposed to be willingly compliant and obedient. Many people and most policies treat servuses as a type of property as above anything else due to their nature. Despite this, the Galactic Confederation of Planets has passed legislation granting citizenship to any Servus that wishes to be independent, no matter how rare that may be.

   In around the year 65, Servuses had fallen out of style, leaving their numbers today a fraction of what they once were due to low production. This is attribited to a gradual increase of machines in industry, leaving Laborer Servuses (Which cost more in food than the average machine takes in energy) out of favor with large industries that would previously use them. Servuses are now almost exclusively seen as Shiner Servuses in low-effort thought-power positions at some companies, and as Steward Servuses kept and cared for by enthusiasts and the wealthy.

pages.name: Laborer Servuses
pages.data:
css
   Laborer Servuses were the first design of the Servus race, endowed great strength, causing them to look very bulky in appearance.
Laborer Servuses' primary purpose, being manual labor or factory work, gives them the reputation of being quite strong, but lacking in intelligence.

pages.name: Shiner Servuses
pages.data:
css
   Shiner Servuses were the second model of Servus ever produced, revealed in late spring of 68. They are very light-framed, and usually come in very faded colors, similar to those of a [!1] Ghillymedic Deorian. Shiner Servuses are typically seen wearing eyeglasses, though though it's not uncommon that they're fake, as they're mainly just an article of clothing their operators apply for aesthetic purposes.
Shiner Servuses were designed to be accountants, mathematicians, Servus supervisors, or in similar intelectual positions.

pages.name: Steward Servuses
pages.data:
css
   Steward Servuses were the third, and final official model of the Servus to be revealed, making its debut in winter of 75. These Servuses are of a normal build for an Deorian, but typically only come in shades of grey.
Steward Servuses were initially designed for first class customers, essentially being butlers to their owners. But, as sales prooved poor, they were generalized to be home assistants, receptionists, waiters, and in many other positions thought of as "sophisticated".

pages.name: Galleate
pages.data:
css
┌────────────────────────────────┐
│Group Name.........: Reuth      │
│Youngling Name.....: Cualt      │
│Status.............: Safe       │
│Vivotype...........: Gaerus     │
│Archetype..........: Humanoid   │
│Domestication......: N/A        │
│Intelligence Class.: Sapient    │
│Lifespan...........: 36±8 Yrs   │
│Time to Maturity...: 7.5±2.5 Yrs│
│# Physical Sexes...: 2          │
│Sexual Polymorphism: Moderate   │
│Procreation Method.: Interactive│
│Diet/Resource Input: Omnivorous │
│Respiratory Gas....: Oxygen     │
│Weight.............: 455±20Kg   │
│Height.............: 198±21cm   │
│Thermal Range......: 274±50k    │
│Blood Volume.......: 11L        │
│Min Conscious Blood: 9L         │
│Top Speed..........: 2.8±0.2m/s │
└────────────────────────────────┘

    Galleates are  smaller in number compared to many other species within the [!1 Silver Stream].  They are efficient, tall, and bulky, with a thick fur coat and fat under their skin that has made them extremely adept in surviving cold environments, such as that of [!2 Gallea].  Their arms are noticeably longer than their legs, with hands made up of 4 digits.  At the tip of each finger is a claw; once used for digging through hard ice, these claws may be utilized as formidable weapons.  Their heads Are round, and their eyes face forward flatly.  A 14-to-19-centimeter-long snout protrudes from it, ending with an almost flat nose.  This snout curves slightly down into the muzzle.  The concave orientable ears of the Galleat can, at full height, be as tall as 13 to 20 centimeters.  Typically, these ears are lightly curled and pressed down flat on the tops of their heads for better heat retention, but they are able to perk up to their full height for higher audio fidelity.�css
    Protruding from the midlength of the side of the skull, Galleates bear a pair of boney horns; Galleat horns are large and curled, and the shape of these horns curve outwards from the head in a slight spiral downwards, the inner curve closely follows the fur coat, with their tips ending near around the same height as the muzzle, just below the horns' origins. The bone around the base of the horn is thicker and reinforced to take force laterally and vertically.  Galleat horns are found on both males and females

    The coloration of Galleates almost exclusively consists of mute colors, with bold colors accounting for very rare mutations.  The underlying skin itself is grey.  Their horns are perhaps the most colorful portion of their body; as as an adolescent, they are a muted turquoise, and as one matures, the bases of the horns grow more purple, forming a unique gradient. This change in color can mainly be attributed to the blood vessels growing into the base of the horn.  Their eyes come in shades of navy blue and purple.  The function of the Galleat horns is initially believed be as a defensive structure against predators, which overtime became a tool for Galleates to compete over territory, resources, and mating partners.  Their use in modern contexts can be found in [! Horns in Galleat Society].

    Galleat blood is fairly darker than most other human species, due to very large amounts of Hemoglobin-analogous metalloprotiens, resulting in a dark purple color.  It is theorized this adaption was made out of a need to extract as much oxygen as possible from [!2 Gallea's] atmosphere, especially within Gallea's numerous mountain ranges.�css
    The differences between male and female Galleats are not extremely various, but still noticable.  A female specimen's horns are generally thinner, with smoother textures.  Structural traits in female Galleats not present in their male counterparts include more abdominal fat, and structural adaptions to deal with Cualt-raising, Cualt-birth and conception such as developed breasts and wider hips.  Hands of female Galleates are also larger by a small amount, with more concave claws.  During pregnancy, the Female Galleat will grow a longer coat and slowly lose pre-pregnancy fat, in a near 1:1 trade-off with the womb's growing volume. The end result can be barely noticable or even entirely imperceivable until after birth.  The cause of this change, or lack thereof, is the fat abdominally breaking down and being transfered to the fetus.  It's widely accepted that this is to give the cualt full protection from the enviroment of Gallea at birth.   Post-pregnancy the female Galleat retains their longer coat, and their frame is permanently thinner than it was prior.  By eating a regular diet, their fat distribution will eventually return to natural amounts.
    
    Adult galleates should consume ~15,600 kcals a day to maintain a healthy body weight.  This large caloric intake is thought to be the driving factor in Galleat populations being stunted.  The large amount of calories needed is also thought to have driven the smaller litter counts and the loss of the specimen's second pair of breasts.  Galleates do not consume this full amount daily and instead feast once or twice a week.  Galleat diet tends to favor fish, salted or smoked meats, dairy, and varied bitter greens.  The preferred flavor palleate of a Galleat tends to favor salted, dried, or smoked flavors, with bitter tastes as accents.  A notable exception is very sweet dairy and pastry products, which Galleates tend to be fond of as a contrast to their hardier meals.

pages.name: Galleate Galleate
pages.data:
css
   Ethnic Galleates are, on average, 175cm (5.7 feet) tall. Native Galleates have dark grey skin and snow white hair.
Native Galleates have a reputation of being very authoritarian, but their also seen as having a strong sense of unity and class.

pages.name: Uudillian Galleate
pages.data:
css
   Galleates from the planet [!1 Uudil] have a typical height of 180cm (5.9 feet) tall. Uudillian Galleates commonly have moderatly grey skin, with a few of them even having grey hair, instead of white.
Uudillians have a small reputation for being good craftsmen and hard laborers.

pages.name: Ghillymedic Galleate
pages.data:
css
   Ghillymedic Galleats are normally 175cm (5.7 feet) tall. These Galleats have much paler skin than their non-lunar kin, but have a wider variety of hair colors. Ghillymedics are of much lighter build, but are also much more agile. This is attributed to the lower gravity of the [1!] lunar state.
Ghillymedics are seen as small, and to some even insignifigant, due to the nation's mininscule size. Ghillymedic individuals are commonly very self-driven, but they tend to occasionally overestimate their abilities.

pages.name: Itascan
pages.data:
css
 [!1] +Itascan Race
 [!2] +Itascan Itascans
 [!3] +Eriian Itascans
 [!4] +Native Urran Itascans

pages.name: Itascan
pages.data:
css
   Itascans, originating from the watery planet of [!1] Itascus, first moon of [!2] Skoth, are a proud race spanning many planets and planetary states.

   Itascans are hairless (Save for head hair) bipeds with front-facing knees. They are of an average build and boast notably thick eyebrows. Despite being close to median size, Itascans are commonly regarded as somewhat short by some groups in popular culture.
   Itascans are adapted to a cool, humid environment.

pages.name: Itascan Itascan
pages.data:
css
   Ethnic Itascans are typically 180cm (5.9 feet) tall. Itascans born from their homeworld tend to have pinkish/tanish skin, blue eyes, and light hair.

   Common, if sterotypical, social traits among Itascan citzens include Militancy, Social Conservatism, and a "headfirst" mindset.

pages.name: Eriian Itascan
pages.data:
css
   Itascans native to the planet of [!1 Erii], second moon of [!2 Skoth], are 185cm (6.0 feet) tall on average. Itascans from Erii usually have notibly pale skin and thin figures.
Eriians have a reputation for acting "uninvested" in situations, always having a cool head. Normally, this gives people an impression that Eriians are "airheads", though it's usually quite the opposite, due to Erii's robust and subsidized educational system.

pages.name: Urran Itascan
pages.data:
css
Itascans coming from the planet [!1 Urra], fourth moon of [!2 Skoth], have a median height of 190cm (6.1 feet) tall. They have notibly darker skin than their lunar neighbors, appearing to be a light bronze. Their hair is typically dark, being a brown or even black on average.

   The [!3 Urran province], and its residents, have gained a reputation from their checkered past. Even though acts of violence and conquest were primarily only taken by [!4 their governer], the average populous of the galaxy perceives them as violent, agressive, or unfriendly.

pages.name: La'Foyan
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +La'Foyan Species
    [!2] +La'Foyan La'Foyan
    [!3] +Armalite La'Foyan

pages.name: La`foyan Human
pages.data:
css
┌───────────────────────────────┐
│Group Name.........:Party      │
│Youngling Name.....:Kit        │
│Status.............:Safe       │
│Vivotype...........:Feiraus    │
│Archetype..........:Humanoid   │
│Domestication......:N/A        │
│Intelligence Class.:Sentient   │
│Lifespan...........:33±8.3 Yrs │
│Time to Maturity...:4±1.29 Yrs │
│# Physical Sexes...:2          │
│Sexual Polymorphism:Low        │
│Procreation Method.:Interactive│
│Diet/Resource Input:Biovorus   │
│Respiratory Gas....:Oxygen     │
│Weight.............:57±10Kg    │
│Height.............:130±25cm   │
│Thermal Range......:302±19°k   │
│Blood Volume.......:6L         │
│Min Conscious Blood:5L         │
│Top Speed..........:18m/s      │
└───────────────────────────────┘

    The La`Foyans, also refered to as "La`Foyrui" or "La`rui", are a common species of human, originating from the planet [!1 La`Foy], that can be found in many civilized places across the stars.  Like most humans, the La`Foyan is bipedal, with a B-Type body.  La`Foyans are covered in full coat of body fur of variable thickness and color (dependant on the subject`s environment/genetics).  These coats can be brown, orange, red, black, or white.  La'Foyan fur is naturally water-resistant; water that touches the coat beads up and bounces off the hairs thanks to a naturally-produced oil.  La`Foyans have short snouts, meaning their noses and jaws extend forward from their faces by 7-9 cm.  On the upper rears of their heads are large, concave, front-facing, orientable ears.�css
    Since La`Foyans are a properly-sentient human species, they are capable of dynamic problem solving, long-term memory retention, and other factors which qualify them as having a general intelligence.  Like other humans, the La`Foyan is a social, communicative creature.  The most common form of communication in modern, civilized La`Foyans is spoken/written [!2 language].  The oral structure of a La`Foyan mouth is adequate for speaking most human languages.  The most commonly spoken language among vivologically-La`Foyan individuals is some dialect of [!3 Nunwei].

    Regarding their anatomy, La'Foyans have mostly-typical B-Type bodies (B-Type meaning the primary joint in each of their legs is backwards-facing).  Specifically, La'foyan legs have two joints and three main segments -- the first segment, the upper leg (in an adult specimen) is approximately 30cm long and connects to the person's hip; the second segment, the mid leg, is also around 30cm long and connects to the upper leg with a bending, front-facing joint (knee); and the lower leg (which is analogous to the midsection of the foot in F-Type bodies), 20cm long, connected to the mid leg at the top with a backwards-facing joint, and connected to the specimen's foot at the bottom.
    La'Foyan feet are digitigrade, meaning they walk on their digits (toes) as opposed to their heels.  Compared to other human species, La'Foyan feet are small, being only about five centimeters wide and seven centimeters long.  La'Foyans have four primary toes at the front of the foot -- each terminated by a claw -- and one rear toe that has evolved to adopt a shape, position, and functionality more similar to a heel.  The La'Foyan heel boasts a small, wide, hooked claw, typically concealed under the foot.  La'Foyans instinctively use this claw for climbing.�css
    Similar to their feet, a La'Foyan hand has four primary digits, and a smaller, opposable digit further back.  La'Foyan hands are furred all over, with exception to their fingertips, which each have a small patch of darker, firmer skin.  This is likely to help with precision grips, as skin has considerably higher traction that fur.  Even though they had evolved from paws, La'Foyan hands are still just about as dexterous as any common human manipulative appendage.

    Like most large mammals of the [!4 Feiraus] vivotype, La'Foyan humans exhibit only subtle traits of sexual polymorphism (meaning different sexes bearing divergent outward traits).  La'Foyan humans are [!5 Caudadimorphic], meaning the only outwardly detectable sign of their physical sex is in their tail.  The La'Foyan tail, on both males and females, has a 60-centimeter flesh-and-bone core.  In males, the tail's fur is emaciated and downy, conforming more to the general shape of the tail's core.  In females, however, the tail's hair is much more volumous and buoyant, creating a large, round, bulbous tail with a pointed end.
    
    Not unlike other humans, La'Foyans are [!6 Faciocentric], meaning they instinctively use others' facial features and expressions for identification and nonverbal communication.  The La'Foyan face is formally defined as the full-width (~21cm) front side of the head.  A common La'Foyan has two small eyes (~2.5cm in diameter) just above their muzzle.  Encircling each eye is a patch of dark fur (darker than their pelt, or even black).  The patch is circular (or at least rounded) with the inner side (the side closer to the middle of the face) starting encircling the eye, and extending outward (away from the middle of the face), away by 4 to 8 centimeters.  The sizes, shapes, and colors of these symmetrical eye patches, combined with general facial structure, are instinctively used by La'Foyans for visual identification of other individuals.�css
    Disregarding the projected muzzle, the La'Foyan face is relatively standard for a human species.  The mouth of any (healthy) adult La'Foyan has 24 teeth.  The four frontmost teeth (top and bottom) are incisors, while all but the rearmost eight teeth are cuspids.  The eight teeth in the back of the mouth are molars.  La'Foyans infants are born with only their cuspid teeth, the incisors being absent to allow for feeding.  At around one [!7 galactic year] of age, the incisors of a juvenile La'Foyan will grow in, followed by their rear molars at around eight years of age.
    
    For its size, the La'Foyan body can be remarkably agile.  Due to having low body fat, a strong grip, thin limbs, and an instinct for climbing, it's relatively easy for a La'Foyan to hone their skills in agility.  These predispositions can be linked back to when the La'Foyan species diverged from the [!8 Kori] species -- a species of small, tree-inhabiting, low-intelligence humanoids.

    A majority of the La'Foyan species of human exists on only four bodies, two of them being the planet [!1 La'foy] and its moon [!9 Armalai], among other [!10 La'Foyan State] territories.  Most races of La'Foyan thrive in warm, humid climates.

pages.name: La'foyan La'foyan
pages.data:
css
Ethnic La'Foyans come from any planetiod under control of the [!1 La'Foyan] empire. They're typically 155cm (5.0 feet) tall, and their fur is a light brown with jet black limbs. 
In popular culture, La'foyans are regarded as a bit "sophisticated" and perceived to be intelligent, though they're also typically quite socially reserved.

pages.name: Armalite La'Foyan
pages.data:
css
   Ethnic Armalites come from the planet [!1 Armalai], the moon of planet [!2 La'Foy], are typically 150cm (4.9 feet) tall. Armalites have a light orange/red coat of fur, with dark grey limbs. Armalites have a strong reputation (among peope outside of the [!3 Vera'Nus] system) for being "suggestive", primarily due to their homeworld, which is outwardly viewed as a tourist trap to some.

pages.name: Tyvant
pages.data:
css
 [!1] +Tyvant Race
 [!2] +Tyventian Tyvant
 [!3] +Urran Tyvant

pages.name: Tyvant Human
pages.data:
css
┌────────────────────────────────┐
│Group Name.........: Group      │
│Youngling Name.....: Kitten     │
│Status.............: Safe       │
│Vivotype...........: Tyvus      │
│Archetype..........: Humanoid   │
│Domestication......: N/A        │
│Intelligence Class.: Sapient    │
│Lifespan...........: 35±9.3 Yr  │
│Time to Maturity...: 7±0.8 Yr   │
│# Physical Sexes...: 2          │
│Sexual Polymorphism: Moderate   │
│Procreation Method.: Interactive│
│Diet/Resource Input: Biovorus   │
│Respiratory Gas....: Oxygen     │
│Weight.............: 71±12kg    │
│Height.............: 180±17cm   │
│Thermal Range......: 307±12K    │
│Blood Volume.......: 7L         │
│Min Conscious Blood: 5L         │
│Top Speed..........: 5±1.3m/s   │
└────────────────────────────────┘

    Tyvants are a sapient human species originating from the planet [!1 Kayan].  They are bipedal and bear B-type bodies.  Common Tyvants are covered in a thin, sleek coat of fur, which may display various colors and unique patterns.  Common Tyvant fur can range from shades of orange to brown to reddish, and typical fur patterns include stripes, spots, splotches, and socks.  Tyvants also have a thick tuft of fur on their heads, which is commonly grown out, groomed, and styled.  Tyvants have two relatively small, curved, front-facing, orientable ears that poke out from the top of their heads.  They have rounded, modest snouts, jutting out just a few centimeters from the face, which hold many pointed, though somewhat dull, teeth.�css
    Their eyes are about 6.4 cubic centimeters in crossectional, and have thin, slit-like pupils.  Their irises tend to be dark hues such as black or brown, though exceptions do exist, and their sclerae are yellow and have a shimmering effect in the dark, commonly misidentified as luminescence.  Most notably, Tyvants have two stalky antennae upon their heads, located somewhere in front of their ears, and a long, dexterous tail which, uniquely, can fan out at the end.  Both of these traits are considered unusual for furred creatures, and especially for sapient ones, as there has never been a single other sapient species recorded to have had either antennae nor fan-like tails as Tyvants do.  

    Tyvants thrive in hot, moderately-humid climates, and the majority of Tyvants live under such conditions.  However, it is noted that Tyvants do have the ability to adapt naturally to the cold: there is a direct relationship between Tyvant fur growth speed, length, and temperature.  When it is cold, Tyvants grow their fur out faster and longer than when the weather is hot.  This winter coat sheds when the weather is warm again, but if it remains unhealthily cold for a Tyvant over a longer period of time (for example, on [!2 Gallea]), the thick fur remains.  A Tyvant`s legs are digitigrade and have two joints, the first being 43 cm below the hip, marking the end of the haunch, bending forward, and a second joint 32 cm above the foot, bending backwards.�css
    Tyvants bear unique tails which have the ability to spread apart like a fan at the end, revealing a display of bright-colored fur that stretches out to be up to a square meter in area.  The purpose of this adaptation was likely to serve as a way to intimidate and stun prey whilst hunting (or startle threats in self-defense), especially in packs, where several Tyvants would be able to fan out their tails at once.  It has been historically popular for Tyvants to customize their tail-fan designs throughout their history in ways ranging from simply dying and artificially patterning the fur to attaching piercings and other forms of jewelry to the tail.

    Tyvants, as most sapients do, communicate primarily through spoken language.  Their mouths are shaped similarly to most other humanoids, allowing them to properly speak most human languages, although they iconically tend to have what could be described as a certain “snarl” when they speak most non-Tyventian languages, especially in rapid or casual speech, regardless of their native tongue.  This is due to the way a Tyvant`s tongue is positioned within the mouth, resulting in perpetual growling which can be suppressed by holding the tongue rigid in the mouth.  As a matter of fact, most [!3 Tyvant languages] are noted to contain phonemic growling.�css
    Tyvants may also subconsciously communicate utilizing pheromones; they release various pheromones under certain conditions, which linger in the surrounding air for varying amounts of time, depending on the pheromone released and its quantity.  On [!1 Kayan] especially, due to the humidity of the air, these pheromones remain suspended in the air for much longer than in more arid climates.  These pheromones are, for the most part, odorless, but can be detected by a Tyvant`s antennae.  There are five pheromones in particular which Tyvants may release and perceive in this way. These are: a pheromone which indicates severe danger or fear, the release of which is triggered by either a spike in heart rate and blood pressure as a result of the fight-or-flight-or-freeze response or alternatively whenever the body enters rigor mortis (albeit this rigor mortis-related response tends to not occur in individuals who die past their middle age); a pheromone which indicates the accomplishment of a task, whose release is triggered by the stimulation of a Tyvant`s brain`s reward circuit; a pheromone which indicates shock or sadness, whose release is triggered by a sudden drop in the hormones responsible for happiness within a Tyvant`s brain; a pheromone which indicates lust in females, produced by female Tyvants during mating periods; and a pheromone which indicates attraction, produced by male Tyvants during Tyvant mating periods as a response to the positive reception of female lust pheromones and the physical attractiveness of the female in question; the male mating response pheromone indicates to the female that he is at least biologically willing to engage in intercourse.  Each of these respective pheromones has served a specific role in aiding the proliferation of the Tyvant species throughout its history, and are still of good use to the species in the modern era, particularly the latter two, which are necessary for the Tyvant reproductive cycle to take place.�css
    On the topic of the Tyvant reproductive cycle, Tyvant mating periods are based on whenever an individual reaches their age of sexual maturity.  Upon reaching this age of maturity, Tyvants begin to experience mating periods which last approximately one [!1 Kayan] month each every six to seven Kayan months.  While they are able to reproduce year-round, the process is streamlined whenever one is in heat.
    Disregarding the previously-mentioned pheromone factors, mating periods in females are highlighted by the accentuation of ones breasts through subconscious flexing, increased sociability, and irritably flaring their tails.  In males, the mating period involves the display of irrationally bold behaviors, such as the loss of inhibitions and potentially violent competition with other males for mates.  Both sexes also experience elevated heart rates and an aversion to dry weather while in heat.

    Evidently, the automatic Tyvant pheromone responses have a tendency to become rather disruptive to ones daily life, especially in the modern era.  The historical solution to this has been, and still is, the burning of a unique incense derived from the bark of a certain equatorial tree native to Kayan whose fragrance binds to and thus blocks Tyvant pheromone receptors.  This incense can be described as having a smoky, almost fruity scent on its own, though it is frequently paired with other materials and substances when burnt to produce alternate scents.�css
    Tyvants are considered to be psychologically communal, preferring to remain in relative closeness with one another.  From an evolutionary standpoint, this was likely meant to influence pack hunting behaviors.  Also, it is noted that many Tyvants bear relatively strong self-discipline, though it is currently partially ambiguous as to whether this is a result of biological factors or socio-environmental factors.  Recent studies done by [!4 Transition Genetics] do show some correlation between genetic factors and the aforementioned behaviors, but it is yet to be definitively proven that the two variables are related.

    From a visual standpoint, Tyvant males and females are best distinguished by the females bearing a larger hip-to-shoulder ratio and two milk-producing breasts.  Unlike the mammaries of most other species which grow enlarged milk sacs, Tyvant breasts are rather muscular, making them firm and more body-conforming than those of other species.  This prevents them from becoming a setback in activities such as hunting or swimming.  In terms of internal physiology, Tyvant females produce sex-unique lust pheronomes during their mating periods and Tyvant males produce attraction pheronomes as a response to the female pheronomes, as previously mentioned.  Other than that, there are no other significant differences between the Tyvant sexes unique to the species compared with the other known sapient species of the galaxy.

    The first Tyvant civilization appeared to have begun somewhere on [!1 Kayan] roughly 2,700 galactic years ago, evidenced by the large presence of prehistoric artifacts found near the equator which date back to that time.  It is believed that the species eventually began to migrate via boats to the other continents, populating the world in its entirety.

pages.name: Tyventian Tyvant
pages.data:
css
   Urran Tyvants' pelts have thin, slick fur with short hairs. Their fur comes in various, yet faded colors, almost exclusively coming with dark stripes over their backs, limbs, and tails.

pages.name: Tyventian Tyvant
pages.data:
css
   Tyventian fur is thick in appearance, yet the hairs making it up are quite thin, making the pelt light and breathable in total. Tyventians have brown, usually tan, fur, usually with patches of a different color.

pages.name: Tuine
pages.data:
css
 [!1] +Tuine Race
 [!2] +Light Tuine
 [!3] +Dark Tuine
 [!4] +Ghillymedic Tuine

pages.name: Tuine
pages.data:
css
   The Tuine race is numerous, coming from the large planet Bius Tu, but majorly spanning over only two nations.
Tuines are the most genetically varied of any known race, though historical events have decreased the population of "varied" subraces. Tuines could be described as elven in many regards, due to their height and pointed ears, and are referred to as such informally.

   Tuines thrive in moderate, dry atmospheres.

pages.name: Light Tuine
pages.data:
css
   Light, or simply "normal", Tuines, are 195cm (6.3 feet) of height on average. Native Tuines have pinkish/brownish hairless skin, save for head hair, which is commonly some degree of blond. Though they may appear lanky, they are typically stronger than one would assume, though not very remarkably strong overall.

   Tuines from the Empire of Bius Tu have a reputation for militancy, mainly due to the nation's strong military presence in the [!1 Galactic Confederation of Planets].

pages.name: Dark Tuine
pages.data:
css
   Dark Tuines, colloquially referred to as "Dark Elves", stand at 200cm (6.5 feet) tall on average, though the accuracy of this data might be inaccurate due to the small sample size. While physically weak, Dark Tuines are very agile and fast on their feet, as well as being very "stealthy". They can be described as having "ebony" skin with silver-grey hair.
Dark Tuines, due to their low numbers, have a very ambiguous reputation, varying greatly among systems. Regardless of that, the general stereotype for Dark Tuines is not unlike that of a feral beast hiding away within the body of a human.

pages.name: Ghillymedic Tuine
pages.data:
css
   Tuines native to the nation of Ghillymede tend to stand at 175cm (5.6 feet) tall. Ghillymedic Tuines have the same aesthetic build as their planetary brethren, but they are measurably weaker in strength, and demonstrate lighter hair and skin.

   Ghillymedics are seen as small by the typical populus , and to some even insignifigant, due to the nation's mininscule size. Gillymedic individuals are commonly very self-driven, but they occasionally overestimate their abilities.

pages.name: Klienfetter
pages.data:
css
   A foriegn race is defined as any race originating from a system which is undocumented and/or unexplored by the [!1 GCP]. A popular, general nickname for a member of any of these races is a "Klienfetter".

   There are many accounts of citizens encountering Klienfetters in all corners of the galaxy. But, there are very few no accounts of Klienfetters being seen on the surface of any planet, being almost exclusive to [!2 Astroports].

pages.name: Armalai
pages.data:
css
┌─────────────────────────┐
│Radius.........: 5,868km │
│Atm. Rating....: B+      │
│Atm. Height....: 72km    │
│Atm. Pressure..: 0.92Atm │
│Surf. Gravity..: 0.76G   │
│Hydrosphere....: Absent  │
│Precipitation..: 13cm/yr │
│Obliquity......: 13.72°  │
│Average Temp...: 302°k   │
│Rotation Period: 43.1Hrs │
│Orbital Period.: 55.4Dys │
│Population.....: 500M    │
│Majority Race..: La'foyan│
│Allegiance.....: Armalai │
└─────────────────────────┘

    Armalai (are-ma-lie) is a small planetoid orbiting the planet of [!1 La'Foy] with a population of half a billion. The state in power wishes to keep its population constant, as evidenced by its [!2 policies on immigration and population control.] Armalai's surface, while naturally barren, is very colorful; typically a collage of reds, oranges, yellows and blues. The city lights of buildings typically consist of the same vibrant colors, brightly visible from orbit, making the planet seem to sparkle when viewed from the dark side. In recent years, a few bodies of water have started to appear in low lying areas due to the atmospheric conditioning of the planet over the decades of its inhabitance.

    To decrease the spread of foreign pathogens, and to allow for more efficient record keeping of transactions, foreign spacecraft are only allowed to land in specified areas. These areas are treated as buffer zones, and require proper documentation and [!3 clearance] to leave and enter primary Armalite lands. Capital Square in the capital city, [!4 Lightfire], is a special landing area, used only by very important landing vehicles (such as those of national leaders) and only in specific time frames.�css
    Armalai has made a reputation for itself as being a prominent source of consumer media of all varieties. Combined, the Armalite industries have a disproportional market share when in comes to consumer media. This is accredited to the planet's swift adoption of [!5 Unil], as most creative material from Armalai is written or produced in the galactic language.

    The Armalite [!6 Time Table String] is "R-0:00T ZT 1Y/9L/37D/4W/10T/100d". Armalai's local time system is heavily based on that of its orbital parent, La'Foy, as it was established when Armalai was still a La'foyan colony. But, because Unil has been a popular language on Armalai since its introduction, the Unil names for units of local time were quickly adopted by the population and were officially standardized in the year 89.

    Notably, all tapwater found on Armalai contains a standard dose of [!7 Ferilin] for population control.�css
There are three classifications for areas on Armalai:
      
    Primary areas:
        These areas are the entertainment focus on Armalai. They contain things like restaurants, theatres, salons, spas, museums, gift shops and other convenient outlets that tourists would need. Primary areas are typically very stylized and visually appealing.  There are sometimes citizen apparel guidelines for while they are in these areas, though they are not mandatory.  Primary areas are littered with discretely placed humidifiers to keep the air comfortably breathable, as opposed to Armalai's typically-waterless atmosphere.
    
    Secondary areas: 
        Secondary areas, informally known as “backstage”, are typically reserved for low rank civilian housing, goods manufacturing, and citizen amenities, such as grocery outlets, doctors' offices, studios, etc. There is a clear distinction between primary, and secondary areas; secondary areas have a severely decreased focus on aesthetics. Secondary areas are by no means unappealing, they are simply appear as any other urban area. There is no regulation on passage between primary and secondary areas, though it is difficult without knowing an area layout; many city planners design roads and zones in a way to silently guide people who aren't intended to visit secondary areas (ex: tourists, news crews, etc.) to stay in Primary ones.
        
    Wilderness:
        Wilderness covers the majority of the body's surface, and consists of dunes, what little farmland Armalai has, and some small bodies of water. For some more developed cities, such as Lightfire, there are short, snugly-fit walls between wilderness and developed areas with doors at regular intervals. There are many potential reasons as to why the walls are built; some say that living next to the open desert can make citizens uncomfortable, the walls make the inside of the city slightly cooler, or that they're simply more aesthetically appealing.

pages.name: Uterku
pages.data:
css
┌─────────────────────────┐
│Radius........: 6,113km  │
│Atm. Rating...: B+       │
│Atm. Height...: 82km     │
│Atm. Pressure.: 1.3Atm   │
│Surf. Gravity.: 0.82G    │
│Hydrosphere...: Absent   │
│Precipitation.: 18cm/yr  │
│Obliquity.....: 13.72°   │
│Average Temp..: 311°k    │
│Population....: 270M     │
│Majority Race.: Tyvant   │
│Allegiance....: Contested│
└─────────────────────────┘
   Uterku, terraformed in 48PW by Tyventia, is a desert planet residing within the [!1 Contested Zone]. The planet was not influenced much by the Urran Invasion of 89, being a simple colony. But, since the dissolve of the Urran empire, the colony has fallen into a state of relative disarray.

   Most of the populous on Uterku is spread over the body in small groupings of less than a thousand in small towns commonly referred to as "communities" And are almost all self-sustaining. Communities are usually built around natural resources, such as water, forests, or valuable minerals. While communities have everything a civilian would need to survive, they hardly ever have [!2 rocket fields] or [!3 shipyards], meaning that civilians looking for import/export must travel to a local megacity, all of which have space infrastructure.

   Journalists have recorded a few notable developments in the last few months regarding order on the body. Many communities have been observed to be maintaining order and upholding (community-defined) laws. But, these communities prefer to separate themselves from other communities. This combined with their inability to launch ships has led to major isolation.

   Communities have been largely peaceful with one another. This is mainly due to Urra confiscating civilian weapons. But one growing faction, the Grey Styx, has raided the weapons out of many old Urran military bases in the area around the planet's old capitol. The group is believed to have control over at least 50 communities, with no known central headquarters.

pages.name: Astroports
pages.data:
css
    A Astroport is any [!1 space station] in orbit around a planet that allows for public access to civilian ships via [!2 docking]. The main difference between a Astroport and a space station is that Astroports have multiple [!3 drop pods] or [!4 drop ships], used for transportation of resources and passengers. Astroports are commonly owned and maintained by the local government of the parent planet/body of the station. Astroports act as nodes in [!5 circuits] for [!6 Warp Ferries], almost exclusively.

pages.name: Warp Ferries
pages.data:
css
   Warp Ferries are vehicles of transit meant for immense distances. Warp Ferries are long, low-thrust vehicles, with many, many [!1 docking ports], and usually a massive [!2 warp core] of any type. Some Warp Ferries are owned and operated by the GCP. Said busses can usually be used by civilians upon paying a small fee and run in the [!3 Transport Circuit, Supply Circuit, or Homeworld Circuit].

   Privately owned Warp Ferries commonly charge a moderate amount for use, but can boast shorter, more specific circuits for cargo and the likes.

   Warp Ferries were conceptualized by the [!4 GUN] as a solution to the growing demand for transportation between planets which were vast distances apart, with warp cores being unthinkably costly for a civilian even then. So, Warp Ferries were proposed shortly after the creation of the GUN by the nation that was then known as Ghilly as a cost-effective plan for transportation.

   Warp Ferries work by hosting a great number of docking ports of all types for ships to connect to. On these ports, only the connection is functional, meaning that docked ships cannot share power, fuel or passengers with the ferry. Once the ship is ready to depart, it warps to the next [!5 astroport] on its circuit, charging a small fee to each boarded ship for each jump made.

pages.name: Docking
pages.data:
css
 [!1] >Docking Ports
 [!2] +Berthing Ports

pages.name: Circuits
pages.data:
css
   [!1] +Circuits
   [!2] +The Transport Circuit
   [!3] +The Supply Circuit
   [!4] +The Homeworld Circuit

pages.name: Circuits
pages.data:
css
   Warp Circuits are repeating lists of [!1 Astroports]/[!2 space] stations used by [!3 Warp Ferries] and similar warp-capable crafts as an order in which to move, going to each location in order from first to last. Some ships may choose to go in reverse order, depending on the needs

   The [!4 GCP] primarily uses three circuits: [!5 The Transport Circuit], [!6 the Supply Circuit], and [!7 the Homeworld Circuit].

pages.name: Transport Circuit
pages.data:
css
   This circuit is intended for general use, stopping by a planet of each [!1 GCP] member nation.

   This circuit goes from Deoria, to Itascus, to Uudil, to Gallea, to Ganemede, to La'foy, to Armalai, and then back to Deoria.

pages.name: Supply Circuit
pages.data:
css
   This circuit is intended for freight and transportation of goods as it makes stops at many agricultural, industrial, and mineral producers and consumers.

   This circuit starts at Ganemede, picking up liquid Hydrogen, liquid Deuterium, and Deuterium Oxide.
   The circuit then heads to Itascus, picking up hardware and delivering liquid Hydrogen. (Iridium is also occasionally picked up here, as freighters from Erii commonly deliver to [!1 Excelcior] as it's the nearest warp stop)
   The circuit then heads to Urra, picking up large quantities of dehydrated produce and small quantities of Uranium, and delivering liquid Hydrogen, and usually all nitrates (organic waste) picked up from other stops.
   The circuit then heads to Armalai, picking up small quantities of textiles, and delivering liquid Hydrogen, hardware, moderate quantities of dehydrated produce, and small quantities of Uranium.
   The circuit then heads to La'foy, delivering hardware and Uranium
   The circuit then heads to Bius Tu, picking up large quantities of hardware, and delivering liquid Hydrogen and small quantities of dehydrated produce.
   The circuit then returns to Ganeimede and reiterates the circuit.

pages.name: Homeworld Circuit
pages.data:
css
   This circuit is designed for quick transport between the worlds of high population density

   This circuit goes from Deoria, to Itascus, to Bius Tu, to Gallea, to La'foy, and then back to Deoria.
 
   Tyventia is currently excluded from this circuit due to the current political climate in the area.

pages.name: Power Armor
pages.data:
css
   Power Armor, originally developed by the [!1 Itascan Military] for the [!2 Itascan World War], is a vehicle that envelops its driver as a suit of armor would. 

   Power Armor plating typically consists of Carbon Steel, Maraging Steel, or even [!3 Wiron] for stronger suits.  Suits of Power Armor can weigh up to a metric ton.  Suits of Power Armor, needing power, have either massive battery banks or compact generators on the back or shoulder.  Suits that are not intended for combat may have their power sources on their chests.

   Power Armor spacesuits, due to their lack of powered limbs, are not technically Power Armor.  Though, they are still considered such due to the wider range of sensors, and having a very high resilience for a space suit.

   The most popular application of Power Armor throughout time has been combat. Power Armor has proven to be almost indispensable in battle, with its most recent use in large-scale warfare being the [!4 Urran invasion] of [!5 Tyventia]. 


   There are two common variants of Power Armor: F-Type and B-Type. Each variant is meant for a certain body type, a user is incapable of properly equipping a suit of Power Armor if it does not match their body type. 

   F-Type, standing for "Front" or "Forward", has front-facing primary leg joints.  This armor can accommodate plantigrade users with front-facing knees.  These users include, but are not limited to Itascans, Tuines, and Galleats.

   B-Type, standing for "Back" or "Backward", has back-facing primary leg joints.  This armor can accommodate digitigrade users with a rear-facing lower knee, with or without a front-facing upper knee.  These users include, but are not limited to La`Foyans and Tyvants.

pages.name: Galactic Confederation of Planets
pages.data:
css
   The GCP is the largest governing body known to the GCP, unifying eight planetary nations.
   Member nations have shared military coordination, space travel infrastructure, and governmental guidelines.
   Twice a year, every seven months (1/01 and 7/01), the leaders of each member nation come together to hold a summit on the [!1 Nexus]. In this meeting, each representative/leader has a chance to discuss the conditions in their state, ideas and proposals for unified action, and plans for future endeavors. 
   The current head organizer of the GCP is [!2 Deoria], which has never been elected out of head office.

   Currently, it is illegal for any two member nations to go to war with one another.  Member nations also all have a mutual defensive pact.  If these rules are broken, the offending member(s) is sanctioned with a universal trade embargo, and possible military action from the rest of the GCP.

   The GCP was originally formed in 17 under the name "Galactic United Nations" (GUN). The founder nations were Deoria, Gallea, Itascus, Erii, and Bius Tu.
   Ghilly joined the GUN in 27 after they separated from the Deorian Empire.
   La'foy joined the GUN in 32 upon its unification.
   Uudil joined the GUN in 38 when the planet met the minimum population requirement of one million citizens.
   Armalai joined the GUN in 40 after rebelling from La'foy.
   The Solar Union joined the GUN in 42 upon being formed by the union of Erii and Uudil
   Ganeimede joined the GUN in 47 after a rebellion from Gallea.
   Ghillymede joined the GUN in 49 upon being formed by the union of Ghilly and Ganeimede.
   The Tyventian Empire joined the GUN in 79 and left in 92 when they were forcibly dissolved.
   The Urran Empire joined the GUN in 92 and remained a member until 102.
   After the Battle of Armalai in 102, the GUN was reformed into the GCP, with unified military coordination and greater international infrastructure.

pages.name: Tyventia Prime
pages.data:
css
   Tyventia Prime is a large, yellow star at about 0.82 Astro Units in size. The star rotates at its equator every 28 days.

   Tyventia Prime's original name was Quaen, but was renamed in 84 once the [!1 Tyventian] capital was moved from planet Nastimye in the Celesse system (which was then named Tyventia Prime) to Prelin in the Quaen system (which is now named Tyventia Prime.)

pages.name: Mark 1
pages.data:
css
┌──────────────────────────┐
│Common Use.Era: 20-85PW   │
│Type..........: Vehicle   │
│Class.........: Military  │
│Power Source..: Battery   │
│Top Speed.....: 7m/3s     │
│Mass..........: 540±20kg  │
│Operating Temp: -30-70c°  │
│Armor Rating..: 16B,16T,4C│
└──────────────────────────┘

   The Mk.1 model of Power Armor was the first functional design for power armor, and the first ever deployed. This model was only F-Type and was only ever produced by the [!1 Itascan Military].

   The Mk.1 model had a very basic design. So much so, that the suit's modules could not open, meaning a pilot would have to first put on the torso, then slide each of their limbs into the limbs of the suit before fastening them on. The helmet did not attach to the torso piece, meaning it rested on the user's head.

   This model was much thinner than modern power armor, conforming more to the body of the driver. 

   Nor the helmet or the torso had any kind of computer, only having the analog actuators in the limbs and a radio transponder in the helmet. As this model was only ever produced by Itascus, the radio's controls are on the inside of the helmet. The radio had rubber buttons that a driver was intended to press and manipulate with their mouth.

   The battery on these suits could last up to 32 hours with moderate usage, a little over one sol on Itascus.

pages.name: Mark 2
pages.data:
css
┌─────────────────────────────┐
│Common Use.Era...: 40-90PW   │
│Type.............: Vehicle   │
│Class............: Military  │
│Power Source.....: Battery   │
│Top Speed........: 8m/3s     │
│Mass.............: 560±20kg  │
│Operating Temp...: -25-75c°  │
│Armor Rating.....: 17B,16T,4C│
└─────────────────────────────┘

   The Mk.2 model was an improvement from its predecessor, boasting proper distribution of shielding to better protect its driver.

   The Mk.2 was the first model of power armor to "open up" from the back. The back of the torso opened “like a book”, with two vertical panels opening outward. Both the legs opened in tandem with above panels. The armor was opened via a lever just below the back of the neck Drivers were intended to first reach their arms into the torso and slide them into the arms of the armor, also moving their head into the attached helmet. The driver would then step into the legs to fully dawn the armor. Once the driver was inside, the armor would power on, activating the actuators and allowing the driver to move with the assistance of the actuators. The armor would be closed either by an exterior assistant, or by the driver jutting their arms back to physically shut the doors. A design flaw in Mk. 2 power armor is that drivers found it very difficult to reach the lever on the back to open the power armor themselves, often requiring assistance from someone else.

   The Mk. 2 is where power armor adopted its “bulky” aesthetic, being the apparent thickness modern power armor is today. The surfaces and plates on this version of power armor are smooth and rounded.

   The battery on these suits could last though up to 46 hours of use, being a small improvement over its predecessor.

pages.name: Origin Theories
pages.data: Void

pages.name: Origin Theories
pages.data:
css
   Currently, there are primarily three theories that predominate origin discussions
across the [!1 GCP]:
  - Panspermia 
  - Naturalism
  - Interventionalism

Panspermia
     Theorized in year -7 by [!2 Doctor Maebelle], Panspermia theory is the most plausible in the eyes of the broader scientific community. Panspermia theory suggests that the similarities between all life is due to a single source of DNA being spread across the galaxy countless years ago. The exact method of which is currently undetermined.

Naturalism 
     Most predominately presented and supported by Entropists. This theorizes that the universe naturally guides life towards a specific form as is simply the nature of things. Whether it's due to life only being able to exist in this form, or the influence of a greater power is debated. This difference, while both still being part of the Naturalist Origin view, has caused a divide in its believers.

Interventionalism 
     The most divine of the three and by far the eldest, Interventionalists are typically from many religious denominations, despite their personal disagreements about the true origin of the world, they all agree that the world was made in image of a higher being that wished for the world to be so. Interventionalist religions are as old as history itself, the idea even spawning independently on isolated worlds.

    Skoth is the first gas giant in the Sol system.  Skoth harbors four moons, three of which bearing civilization.  Skoth's northern hemisphere is a deep brown, with a pale blue on the opposite hemisphere, and a light tan color sandwiched in the middle along the equator. 

    Some primitive [!1 Itascan] civilizations thought Skoth to be a holy place in the sky, the final destination of souls after they've departed the land of the living.
     
    For a gas giant, Skoth is unusually close to its parent star.  Scientists are still trying to explain Skoth's origins and how it managed to form so close to Sol.
    As well as its proximity to its star, Skoth is also unusually small and dense for a gas giant.  A large proportion of Skoth's mass (2.622x10^26 kg) is thought to be substances that are solid at room temperature, such as silicates.

pages.name: Warp Drive
pages.data:
css
     A warp relocation, also referred to as a "warp", is described as an action where an object (typically a spacecraft) changes its position in space without changing its velocity, orientation, or mass. Warp drives cannot travel through matter (without the craft sustaining damage). If such a drive were able to remove itself from point A and place itself at point B without any regard for the space in between, that would be teleportation, not warping. There are three types of warp drives currently in use across [!1 Asmodea], Dark Warp Drives, Slug Drives, and Light Warp Drives.

pages.name: Warp Bubbles
pages.data:
css
    A warp bubble is the sphere or spheroid around a [!1 Warp Core] that determines what will transported upon [!2 warp]. The size and shape of said spheriod tied directly to that of its warp core. Warp can not occur if there is matter intersecting the of edge the warp bubble. IE: the craft is larger than its warp bubble (or another craft is too close), rendering it unable to warp.

    A warp bubble is in no way a physical object, it is simply an arbitrary marker for a 3-dimensional space.

pages.name: Warp Cores
pages.data:
css
   A warp core is a device that enables a craft or object to warp.  Warp cores can cost anywhere from $6,000,000 to $150,000,000 depending on the desired [!1 warp bubble] size. 

   Warp core modules can range in dimensions from the size of a briefcase for a small probe, to the size of a car for a [!2 warp ferry]. 

   Inside of a warp core is a sphere of [!3 Aptha]. The size of this sphere is proportional to the size of the core's warp bubble.  This Aptha core is the most important component in the warp core module, as it's the component that allows for warp. 

   Though warp cores vary in size, shape, and specific function, all warp cores share a few characteristics: A mass of aptha, a chalice for the aptha, an energy infuser for the aptha, and a Neutron Emitter.
   The Aptha chalice is what holds and shapes the mass of Aptha for use.  Warp cores work by first charging the mass of Aptha (refered to as "the core") with [!4 Qi Energy] using the Energy Infuser.  Then, the Neutron Emitter fires Neutrons evenly against the "back" of the Aptha core, in the direction the warp bubble is intended to go.

   Nifilhiem is within the goldilocks zone of Myotis, yet readings conclude the planet to be a wasteland of thin carbon sand. Creating a silvery black surface. The atmosphere has a lethal level of carbon dioxide for most known forms of life.

   The weather on Nifilhiem is known for being Chaotic. The black sand on the surface gives the planet an albedo of near zero. This, mixed with the fact that the atmosphere has low heat capacity, means that Nifilhiem has a higher-than-average temperature/pressure gradient between the day and night hemispheres of the body.

   To ancient [!1 Tuines], Nifilhiem was thought to be a sort of portal. Where this supposed portal led depended on one's folklore, but Nifilhiem's reputation was broadly that of a heavenly body of the afterlife or divine power.

pages.name: Classification
pages.data:
css
Planets are rated by the Surface Survivability Index to determine how livable they are.
┌─┬───────┬─────┬───────┬────────┬─────────┐
│R│  ATM  │O2(%)│Temp(k)│Fatality│Equipment│
├─┼───────┼─────┼───────┼────────┼─────────┤
│F|   0   | Any |  Any  |  ≤100% |SpaceSuit│
│+|0.001+ | Any |  Any  |  ≤100% |SpaceSuit│
│-|.01-200| Any | <4000 |  ≤100% |SpaceSuit│
│E|.05-140| Any |50-2500|  ≤100% |SpaceSuit│
│+|.07-125| Any |95-1500|  ≤100% |SpaceSuit│
│-|.09-110| Any |215-400|  <100% |SpaceSuit│
│D|0.1-100| Any |230-373|  <97%  | Exosuit │
│+|0.15-80| Any |235-373|  <95%  | Exosuit │
│-|0.25-65|8-70 |237-328|  <13%  |Clothing │
│C|0.3-50 |12-60|255-319|  <6%   |Clothing │
│+|0.4-45 |15-50|270-312|  <5%   |Clothing │
│-|0.45-40|16-45|272-311|  <2%   |Clothing │
│B|0.5-35 |16-40|274-310|  <2%   |Clothing │
│+|0.55-30|17-30|279-310|  <1%   |Clothing │
│-|0.6-20 |17-26|285-306|  <.3%  |  None   │
│A|0.7-13 |19-23|289-302|  <.1%  |  None   │
└─┴───────┴─────┴───────┴────────┴─────────┘
Key:
   R - Rating letter. (Ex: B, A-, C+)

   ATM - Atmospheric pressure in ATM at the surface.

   O2 - Oxygen percentage in the atmosphere.

   Temp - Average temperature of the air/surface during the day.

   Fatality - The fatality rate due to respiration of the atmosphere (disregarding temperature) over an extended period of time. This value typically describes the toxicity of the elements in the air.

   Equipment - Minimum level of equipment required for human survival.

The planet's overall rating is determined by its lowest score out of the five categories.

   Vhriley is a small planet baked by its proximity to Simia. It's a dark, crater-ridden body commonly blasted by solar winds. Though the planet has no stationary atmosphere, the constant, thin stream of Hydrogen and Helium from the sun has eroded the microparticles on the surface into smoother grains unlike those on other atmosphere-less bodies.
   
   Observations imply that Vhriley's rotation has been slowing over the time of its existence. Scientists estimate that its rotation may halt completely within the next 2,000,000,000 years.
   
   Vhriley was one of the last planets discovered by ancient [!1 Deorians]. Due to this, Vhriley has little place in ancient Deorian mythology.

│Rotation Period: 1.5 Days │
│Orbital Period.: 1.5 Days │
│Population.....: 3.9B     │
│Majority Race..: Itascan  │
│Allegiance.....: Itascus  │
└──────────────────────────┘

    Itascus ("it-ass-cuss") is the blue marble mother of the [!1 Itascan species], and holds a living population of almost 4 Billion people.  Itascus is a lunar world, coated with oceans populated by a few specs and swaths of land, scattered along the surface like dust in the wind.  Since Itascus's fauna is of the [!2 Itaus] vivotype, the plant life covering the planet's land masses is light green in color, contrasting well with the world's light blue oceans.
    Unlike most other lunar worlds, Itascus still has a very active geology.
     
    From a distance, the planet has a blue sheen around it due to its tall atmosphere.  From the surface, the sky appears to be a light cyan-blue, with deep red sunrises and sunsets.  The Itascan atmosphere is even thick enough that nighttime views of the cosmos appear slightly hazed. 

    Due to its proximity to its orbital parent, Itascus is tidally locked to [!3 Skoth], meaning that one side of Itascus is always facing the gas giant. On this side, the temperature is lower than the average for the planet, the middle most part of it being in a state of eternal winter.  Sometimes, this part of the ocean can become cold enough that its surface freezes over, creating a "third ice cap" on Itascus.  The area in which this temporal icecap manifests is known as "Umbrea".�css
    Itascus' [!4 Time Table String] is "N-10:00T ZT 1Y/12L/18D/20T/40d".  The point on Itascus's surface which always faces Skoth marks the [!5 Longitudinal Origin] in the [!5 STP System] for this planet.

    Itascus has three primary landmasses over its surface, each of which being an [!6 Itascan Governmental Province].  These are the Ferika Continent/[!7 Capital Province], the Aphoterra Continent/[!8 Far Province], and the Kullmia Continent/[!9 Kullmi Province].
    Ferika is located 90° east of the Umbrea ice cap, and takes up 14% of the surface of the planet.  Throughout Ferika are many mountain ranges, with various plains, valleys, and deserts strewn between them.  Along the east coast of Ferika is an extensive, deep geological fault line.  Tectonic shift along this fault line over millions of years has caused the southern half of Ferika to be long and strait-like, almost reaching Itascus' South Pole.
    Cutting through the northern half of Ferika is the Nerona River.  Fed by hundreds of smaller streams and creeks throughout the northern half of the continent.  The Nerona River is large enough that it's easily visible from space, being a distinct part of the continent's outline.�css
    Aphoterra and Kullmia are opposite of Ferika, 90° to the West of the Umbrea ice cap.  These two continents are adjacent to one another, with Aphoterra being due north of Kullmia.  On the east-most side of the pair of continents is the Aphokull Land Bridge, which is 322km long and 108km wide.
    Apoterra's edges are made up of plateaus, plains, and sheer coastal cliffs.  More inland, on the west side of Apoterra, are great plains on shallow, treeless soil, thought to be caused by the movement of long-gone glaciers.  On the Eastern half of Apoterra's inland is home to hilly woods and thick forests covering medium-height mountain ranges.  Apoterra exists over 9% for the planet's total surface.
    The Kullmian continent is much more rugged than its northern neighbor.  On the eastern and western faces of Kullmia are extensive mountain ranges, spanning from the northern to southern shores.  In the middle of these mountains is the vast Kullmian Desert, which sees virtually no rainfall throughout the year.  Kullmia takes up 11% of the planet's surface by area.
    The ocean area separating these continents, called the Aphoterra Bay or Kullmian Bay (name varies by location), divides them by 429 kilometers at its thinnest and 728 kilometers at its widest.
     
    A common sight on Itascus is [!10 airships], being a popular mode of travel both between and within cities. Many skyscrapers in densely populated areas have [!10 skydocks] for airships on their higher stories. For urban travel, it's not uncommon to see civilians riding and driving [!11 cars].

pages.name: Erii
pages.data:
css
┌───────────────────────────┐
│Radius........: 4,623km    │
│Atm. Rating...: B-         │
│Atm. Height...: 52km       │
│Atm. Pressure.: 0.69atm    │
│Surf. Gravity.: 0.68G      │
│Hydrosphere...: Absent     │
│Precipitation.: 16cm/y     │
│Obliquity.....: 21.4°      │
│Average Temp..: 280°k      │
│Population....: 380M       │
│Majority Race.: Itascan    │
│Allegiance....: Solar Union│
└───────────────────────────┘

     Erii, the second moon of Skoth, is a light grey world, with black speckles along the surface where astroids have struck to reveal the darker soil underneath. The atmosphere of the planet is barely visible, giving it a ghostly shell around the body.

     Erii was one of the first planets ever discovered by primitive [!1 Itascans]. Unlike Skoth, which is only viewable from one, static hemisphere of Itascus, Erii can be seen from any point on Itascus, lest the surface of the forest planet or the image of the gas giant in the sky blocks it.

     Erii's first permanent residents arrived before warp drive was discovered, year 23 Pre-warp. The first three colonists, with more migrants later, started the creation of a city that is now the capital, named Entoke City. Since the boom in space travel, Erii has been a planet heavily valued for its natural resources, primarily Iridium.

pages.name: Skypeir
pages.data:
css
┌──────────────────────┐
│# Of Docking Ports:80 │
│# Small Shipyards.:2  │
│# Large Shipyards.:0  │
│# Of Public Suites:36 │
│On-Board Staff....:~20│
│Mass (Tonnes).....:860│
└──────────────────────┘
     Skypeir is Erii's public Astroport. Skypeir was initially created as a pit stop during Eriis colonization, and is now used as the planet's [!1 Astroport]. 
     
     Skypeir can be described as 'T' shaped, with small extrusions stemming radially from the base leg. These extrusions are commercial, administrative, service, or industrial modules. The modules hold everything from energy, to fuel, to shops. At the bottom of the base leg is a medium [!2 Gravity Ring], holding the recreation area and suites. The other two legs of the 'T' hold the public [!3 Docking Bay] and the two [!4 Shipyards].
     
     There are no privately owned modules or shipyards on Skypeir; all spaces are rented by shopkeepers directly from the [!5 Eriian] government. In addition, when renting shipyard time, planned constructions must also be approved by Eriian officials.
     
     In the name of defense, Skypeir has six radial-mount .50 Cal. cannons, along with two laser [!6 Point Defense] nodes.
