pages.name: Biopsychology
pages.data:
css
   [!1] +Info [Stub]
   [!2] +Faciocentrism [Stub]

pages.name: Biopsychology
pages.data:
css
    Biopsychology is the study of psychology which is derived from Biology.  Specifically, this field is most commonly in regards to [!1 Humans], though, many things learned through Human Biopsychology have been observed in other, [!2 non-sapient] species as well.

    Common Biopsychology is applicable in most places in the known, colonized galaxy, as many psychological traits and behaviors observed though Common Biopsychology are observed in a majority of [!2 cognizant] life, even across different [!3 Vivotypes].

pages.name: Faciocentricity
pages.data:
css
    Many cognizant species, and all known species of [!1 Human], bear a biopsychological trait known as Faciocentricity.  Specimens of Faciocentric species are observed to inherently, subconsciously recognize and remember facial features of other members of their species (or sometimes even members of other species).

    Specifically, faces in Faciocentric species can be used for emotional expression, nonverbal communication, and even personal identification.

pages.name: Weapon Accessories
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Atlas Universal Charger

pages.name: Atlas Universal Charger
pages.data:
css
┌──────────────────────────────────────┐
│Common Use Period...: 92 - Present    │
│Unit Cost...........: $90/unit        │
│Manufacturer........: [!1 Atlas Corp] │
└──────────────────────────────────────┘

    The Atlas Universal Charger is an essential accessory for any product manufactured by [!1 Atlas Corp] that utilizes a capacitor bank or battery.  The plug itself is cylindrically-shaped and 4cm in diameter, with 5 metal prongs sticking out of the end.  This end, in turn, gets inserted into the charging port of any Atlas capacitor or battery (the other end is connected to a power source).  Once inserted, the plug is locked in place so it cannot fall out.  The charging port locks in place via a spring-loaded latch.

    When purchased from a registered vendor, the Atlas Universal Charger comes with a replacement warranty lasting until one (1) [!2 Galactic Year] after purchase.  While under warranty, if the charger breaks through normal use, the consumer may ship the broken charger back to Atlas headquarters -- based on [!3 Itascus] -- and a replacement will be shipped back to them.  Shipping rates may apply.

pages.name: National Itascan Culture
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Itascan Work & Meal Schedule
    [!2] +Spoofball
    [!3] +Food

pages.name: Itascan Work & Meal Schedule
pages.data:
css
    The daily life of a common [!1 Planetary Itascan], any many [!2 Itascan Nationals], starts as any day does for most denizens of Asmodea: Waking up to breakfast.  However, the breakfast of a common Itascan is unique -- it is typically their largest meal of the day, consuming between 3,600 and 4,200 joules of energy in just one sitting!  Breakfasts this large became commonplace in ancient times, designed to give workers the extra calories need to comfortably make it through the cold days on Itascus.  Some breakfast specialties observed across the planet include domesticated lizard eggs, Reptile sausage, or Itascan Grizzly Steaks, complimented by a side of greens, such as Itascian Sourgrass.
    
    After eating breakfast, the common Itascan heads to work for the day.  Come lunchtime -- defined by local noon -- employees pause their work and head to a designated room eat their packed lunch.  If one's place of work has a proper mess hall, they will order food from the in-house kitchen (as opposed to packing their own).  And Itascan lunch is the smallest meal of the day, usually just being a sandwich or seed roll.  Within Itascan companies, lunchtime typically ushers in a 30 to 45 minute lunch break.  After which work resumes until the end of the work day, which is typically in the mid-afternoon, though sometimes later.�css
    For most Itascans, from this point on in the day is leisure time, just doing things like going home, partying at a public venue, spending time with their friends, and whatever else they feel like they want to do.  Dinnertime can happen either in the home or at a public resturaunt.  An Itascan dinner is typically protein-heavy; usually, dinner has some type of meat as its main course, with small sides of greens or grains.
    
    At bedtime, a common Itascan will put their children to rest and climb into bed with their spouse, resting themself up for the next day.  The Itascan work cycle is 10 days in total (akin to [!3 Standard Galactic Time]), and is 7 days on, 3 days off, and is equal to exactly 10 orbits of Itascus around [!4 Skoth].

pages.name: Itascan Planetary Culture
pages.data:
css
    [!1] ~Common Work & Meal Schedule

pages.name: Energy Rifles
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Info
    [!2] +ACLR-X "Warden"

pages.name: ACLR-X "Warden"
pages.data:
css
┌────────────────────────────┐
│Use Period......: 98-Present│
│Weight..........: 4.5 Kg    │
│Ammunition......: ACLR Bank │
│Clip Capacity...: 8 Rounds  │
│Shots/3 seconds.: 3         │
│Loading Type....: Semi-auto │
│Reload Time.....: 3s        │
│Accuracy Rating.: 8         │
│Precision Rating: 4         │
│AP Rating.......: 4         │
│Damage Type.....: Thermal   │ 
│Manufacturer....: [!1 Altas]│ 
└────────────────────────────┘

    The ACLR-X “Warden” sports an ambidextrous grip, and utilizes Atlas Corp’s first ever 8-charge rotating capacitor bank.  As this is a pulse laser rifle, it is best used for anti-personnel applications.  Although the Warden makes built with a new capacitor bank, it is still charged with an [!2 Atlas Universal Charger].

    Built into the upper receiver is eight LEDs which act as a charge counter.  This counter starts with all eight LEDs lit, and one LED dims for each shot fired.  The addition of this counter is so the user can focus more on firing the weapon, not having to keep count of the ammunition in their head, as the counter will do it for them.
    The barrel of the rifle does not extend past the front handguard, making the weapon rather compact and easily transportable when the capacitor is ejected.  The eight charge-capacitor can be inserted and ejected from what would be considered the upper receiver of the rifle, and extends out from the sides of the weapon.  Once chambered, a pin holds the capacitor in place while allowing it to rotate.  The pin extends beyond the back of the chambered, ending with a small pull handle.  To eject the capacitor, the user must disengage the pin by pulling its handle (spent capacitor banks can be recharged).�css
    As per standard of Atlas, the rifle features universal tactical rail mounts on the upper receiver, and on all four sides of the handguard.  As this is a rifle that will be intended for use on extended operations as well as short-term engagements, extensive research went into making sure the rifle is built as light as possible, using similar methods of manufacturing and materials that went into the [!3 Vega].

    This is the second weapon produced by Atlas Corp., with the company's vision still being set on producing laser weaponry.  Purchase of rifle will run a buyer around $750, including one capacitor bank.  Individual 8-round capacitor banks for the ACLR-X are sold at $80 dollars per unit.  Atlas also manufactures 6-round banks, which are sold at a cheaper $60.

    It was documented multiple times during product testing that many who fired the Warden mentioned that it "gives off a satisfying smell of ozone".

pages.name: Weapon Technologies
pages.data:
css
   [!1] +Kinetic Bombardment Weapons
   [!2] +Railgun Propulsion [Unwritten]
   [!3] +Point Defense Weaponry [Unwritten]
   [!4] +Gyro Bullets

pages.name: Kinetic Bombardment Weapons
pages.data:
css
    Kinetic Bombardment Weapons (KBW) are weapons which utilize an intert, heavy payload moving at incredible speeds to bombard a target.  KBW payloads weigh between 50 kilograms to 100 tons, and, at their top speeds, move at over two kilometers per second.  Modern KBWs are cheaper than explosive ordinace, as raw heavy metals, in most territories, are cheaper than high-yield explosives per joule of destructive power.
    
    Most [!1 nations] which maintain an arsenal of KBW construct payloads in orbit, with material mined from space objects (such as asteroids).  This is because raw materials used in KBWs are very heavy, and present a considerable cost when trying to bring them to space from the surface of a planet.
    
    Since the early 20s, KBWs have been dropped from orbit when used (as opposed to being dropped from any lower altitudes), with devistating results.  For optimal effectiveness, KBWs dropped from orbit are built with basic flight computers controlling actuated fins to allow the projectiles to make course adjustments mid-flight, after the projectiles have entered an atmosphere.
    
    Kinetic Bombardment Weapons were invented on [!2 Itascus], and refined through the [!3 Itacan Great War], in which it became an impactful, history-changing weapon.  Originally, KBW were dropped from aircraft, but they were found to be much more effective when dropped from orbit.

pages.name: Old Nations of Itascus
Finnia Accords
pages.data:
css
    On 8/14/23, the member nations of Social Pact called a ceasefire in the [!1 Itascan Great War], with victory firmly in their grasp.  The national leaders realized this was an unparalleled opportunity to change the future of Itascus as a whole, and promptly took it.

    The Social Pact agreed that Itascan Unification was essential their maintaining of power, and perhaps even survival of their species.  Aware that they had the planet in their grasp for the time being, they realized that now was the time to take action and make Itascus one.  The Finnia Accords continued for two months, and the ceasefire was extended indefinitely.  Though, nonetheless, the Great War was technically still raging.  In this time, Social Pact member nations gathered their most accomplished social scientists and experienced political figures to draft a structure for a world government.�css
    The Finnia Accords took one and a half [!2 galactic months] to draft a proposal for a world government, with routes being added to the proposed structure to allow for ammendments to be made immediately after being instated.
    On 9/35/23, the Social Pact requested delegates from all other nations of Itascus to meet in Saryllia for peace talks.  Though, more than peace was to be discussed.  These talks would soon be known as the Unity Summit.  The non-Social-Pact delegates of Itascus's nations were told in, no uncertain terms, that nations of the Social Pact offered complete ceasation of conflict toward any nationstate which agreed to be annexed into a planetary Itascan government.
    
    Each delegate was sent back to their respective nation to relay the proposal to their leaders.  The deal itself is now known as "The Unity Deal".  The nations Borone, Queensland, and Carria agreed to the deal, while Amora's leadership refused.  They justified their refusal stating such a government would not be in the best interest of the people of Amora, or the people of Itascus abroad.  Historians agree, if Amora had agreed to the deal, the [!1 Itascan Unification War] would have ended then and there.

pages.name: Arms Research Companies
pages.data:
css
    [!1] ~Itascan Dynamics

pages.name: Untitled
pages.data: [Unwritten]

pages.name: Itascan World War
pages.data:
css
    The Itascan Great War (A.K.A. the Itascan Unification War) was a war between the [!1 eight major nations of Itascus]: Corrum, Amenira, Saryllia, and Finnia formed a collective called the Social Pact, while Amora, Borone, Queensland, and Carria formed the South Itascan Treaty Organization, or SITO.
    The Social Pact nations were bound by their common interest in their nations' economic structure, then called "Socio-Capitalisim", which was a form of socialist economy that provided necessities to its people through considerable taxes, while still respecting personal capital.  Meanwhile, the nations of SITO saw Socio-Capitalisim as an infectious, volatile, and unfruitful economic system which hindered a nation's growth, threatening the economies of their own states, and that of Itascus at large.
    
    The war had sparked the attention of those all across the [!2 Silver Stream], leading some galactic powers to intervene.  Alien [!3 Deorian] forces supported the Social Pact, whilst [!4 Tuine] forces supported SITO, partially making the Itascan Great War a proxy war these two galactic powers.  The war was started over SITO nations passing the Ameniran Exclusion Act (AEA), which prevented all Amenirans entering SITO territory, banning trade with Amenira, and threatening to neutralize all Ameniran spacecraft that orbit over SITO lands, which threatened to greatly hinder, or even end, Amineran space exploration.

    A year after the AEA was instated, Amenira gathered leaders of the other member nations of the Social Pact and rallied them for war, explaining that SITO only wanted to slow the progress of Socialized Capitalisim, and that their own nations could very well be next.  This meeting would come to be known as the Social Summit.  After that meeting, the nations of the Social Pact formally declared war on the nations of SITO.  This officially started the Itascan Great War on 5/12/17.�css
    Queensland, which shared their northern border with Amenira, fell to their invasion before foriegn forces could aid them, as their capital was firebombed to the ground amongst many other of their cities.  During the ensuing peace talks, there were accounts of the Ameniran president slapping the king of Queensland.  With the Silver Stream sitting in the wake of First Contact, it didn't take long for news of Itascus' war to spread to other nearby worlds.  Specifically, denizens of [!5 Deoria] sympathized with the Social Pact, while Bius Tu saw a potential ally in the powers of SITO.
    
    Three years into the conflict, as battles were being fought on multiple fronts, foreign military aid from Deoria, backing the SP; and Bius Tu, backing SITO, had arrived.  The majority of Deorian Aid was in the form of laser weapons and military ordinance with only a few hundred Deorian soldiers, while Bius Tu sent many dozen versatile military transport vehicles and almost two-thousand Tuine infantry members.

    After the arrival of foriegn military aid, the nations of the Social Pact pushed South in a deadly campaign known as the 6 Month Charge, where it is said "they did not take one step back".  Eventually, Carria had to move their capital south, and in a desperate attempt at survival, unleashed their "Death Machines" -- mechanized, weaponized, quadrapedal walking armored vehicles, which were the precursor to modern [!6 Power Armor].  The advent of mechanized warfare caught the Social Pact off gaurd, and the Great Retreat over Carria began as Carrian Death Machines, accompanied by [!4 Tuine] tanks and APCs, pushed the Social Pact's forces back.�css
    While they were retreating, Amenira resorted to more desprate measures as the Social Pact's combined forces fled.  Amenira soon found that ultra-heavy guided [!7 kinetic projectiles] dropped from aircraft were remarkably effective at taking out the Carrian Death Machines.  Within a week, the 100 death machines of Carria fell to Ameniran Air Superiority Division bombers, marking the end of the Great Retreat over Carria.  At this time, Amenira launched their Hammerfall Orbital Strike sattelites -- which utilized the same technology as the [!7 kinetic projectiles] used against the Death Machines -- to execute their ultimate warplan.  As the Social Pact retook the front, they comandeered any remaining working War Machines, with each member nation's military taking any intact specimens to reverse-engineer.

    Deorians brought in their [!8 laser rifles], adding the smell of seared flesh and ozone to the many scents of the great Itascan battlefield.  The tables turned back in the favor of the Social Pact, and another offensive began.  On the oceans of Itascus, the Social Pact and SITO waged war with metal beasts called warships, manned by legions of crewmen.  These warships were endowed with the largest guns ever concieved by Itascan scientists at that time, shielded by armor once considered to be impossibly thick.�css
    During the later years of the Great War, years 20 to 23 [!9 Post Warp], the massive guns of warships were replaced with [!10 hypersonic railguns], capable of shooting targets at 50 kilometers away.  The railgun design was invented by Ameniran Dynamics -- now known as [!11 Itascan Dynamics], the premier kinetic weapons manufacturer of the [!12 Itascian Military].  SITO warships soon carried planes, where pilots would attack Social Pact ships with bombs and guided rockets.  Social Pact nations responded by fielding defensive aircraft carriers of their own, and attatching laser [!13 point defense] grids to their seacraft.  As Social pact warships pushed south, they launched missiles and railgun shells to support ground troops near the coast.  As they aproached the southern parts of the Patrician Ocean, into the Boronian Sea, Borone surrendured under threat of nuclear fire.
    
    In the last year of the war, Amenira made conservative use of their Hammerfall Orbital Strike system, bombarding some opposing cities with monolithic projectiles of pure tungsten, devistating structrues and causing general chaos in SITO population centers.  But the nation Amora, outside of the knowledge of the Social Pact and without informing any other SITO nation, had also constructed their own, smaller, kinetic bombardment station in Itascan orbit, copying the Amenirans.  Secretly, they targeted the Ameniran capital, a large city on the east coast of the [!14 Ferika Continent].  Off the east shore of Ferika is a deep geological fault line, which, at the time, was primed to shift.  The Amoran military dropped two rods of pure tungsten 11 kilometers off the coast of the Ameniran capital.  The rods were to be dropped one after another, with the second rod acting as redundancy if the first rod failed to trigger the fault line.�css
    On 1/38/23, an 11-ton rod of tungsten struck the ocean just off the Amineran coast, triggering a wave over 50 meters tall to strike the Ameniran capital.  The force of the wave, as well as the ensuing flood, decimated the city by toppling buildings and leveling neighborhoods in an artificial disaster which killed tens of thousands.  The capital, which previously had a population of over one million, was crippled in under an hour.  In the aftermath, almost a fifth of the city's population had perished from the flood, or being unable to escape through the crumbled infrastructure of what was once a metropolis.
    The Itascan president survived the flood thanks to the Presidential Bunker he had commissioned at the beginning of the war.  Immediately, in under a day, the Itascan president ordered a large Ameniran city to the west, further inland on the slope of a mountain, to be adopted as a temporary military headquarters and capital.  This city, after the war, would come to be the official capital city of the planet.
    
    Shortly after the fall of the Ameniran capital, Deoria sent an order to withdraw their forces from Itascus, leaving their military hardware, but returning Deorian soldiers to their homeworld.  The withdrawl was a bad sign for citizens of Social Pact nations, and re-sparked civil discussions regarding the ethics of stronger extrastellar powers meddling in Itascan affairs.�css
    On [!15 Erii], as the Great War waged on, Ameniran and Carrian colonies openly harassed eachother, stealing supplies, damaging hardware, and even attempting to occupy opposing colonies in decentralized acts of hostility.  At the time, Erii's atmosphere wasn't yet breathable, as it still had too high a concentration of Carbon Dioxide.  Subsequently, this meant colonies required a constant flow of supplies and functioning machinery to keep their occupants alive.  Through the skirmishes, entire colonies suffocated and starved due to supply shortages, giving the phenomenon the name of "General Eriian Famine".  Eventually, Carrian colonies submitted to the Ameniran attacks, effectively winning the war on Erii.  Though, with conflict in the air, ideas of Eriian Sepratism (from Itascus) spread among Eriian reactionaries.

    At this stage of the war, SITO was on the backfoot, and national leaders considered surrendering to the waves of Social Pact fighters and war machines.  The Carrian Death Machines had been reverse-engineered by Social Pact militaries into an archaic form of Power Armor which was being eagerly deployed onto the battlefield.  Much of Itascus had been devistated by the war, and the public cry for peace had grown exponentially louder as casualties rose.
    With SITO nearly at its knees, and the Social Pact strained and beaten by the conflict, the world collectively agreed it was time for change.  SITO had been beaten, and the Social Pact controlled the terms of surrender.  In many Social Pact cultures, the idea of a unified Itascus being essential to survival in the emerging interstellar stage had become very popular.  This is partially accredited to opposing Tuine forces remaining active on Itascus this far in the war; [!16 Tuines] had even become demonized in some circles.�css
    On 8/14/23, the leaders of the Social Pact conviened and announced a month-long ceasefire, which the remaining active members of SITO -- Amora and Borone -- agreed to.  The Social Pact held a summit of their own, with the Pact's national leaders meeting in the capital of Finnia.  This summit would come to be known as the [!17 Finnia Accords].  In these accords, a government structure for a unified Itascus was drafted and vetted, with the Social Pact offering to stop hostilities towards each nation that agreed to be annexed into the new Itascan nation.
    The only nation to refuse was Amora, whose leaders cited such a plan would forsake individual nations' powers and rights.  Shortly after their refusal, the Great War resumed, though only on Amoran fronts.  
    
    Only a day into the resumed conflict, the Amoran capital was relentlessly bombarded from orbit by Ameniran military spacecraft in what would become a devistating, intimidating show of space-based weaponry and Ameniran power.  Amoran ground troops were quickly overrun by the combined infantry of every Social Pact nation within an [!18 Itascan Week].  The nation of Amora surrendered on 10/2/23, agreeing to be annexed into an Itascan planetary Nation and officially ending the Itascan World War.

pages.name: Energy Rifles
pages.data:
css
    Energy Rifles are rifles which make use of the discharge of energy to damage or kill a target.  Despite typically not having as much power as [!1 Ballistic Rifles], Energy Rifles that make use of [!2 Laser Emitters] are remarkably accurate, and, subsequently, are popular as Sniper Rifles, or other in other applications that require high precision over a distance.

pages.name: Fibers & Fabrics
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Carbon Fiber

pages.name: Carbon Fiber
pages.data:
css
    Carbon Fiber is a material made of fibers of carbon (graphite) woven into sheets.  The constituent graphite fibers usually have a diameter between 5 and 10 micrometers.  Carbon Fiber is used in high-performance parts thanks to its high durability and strength-to-weight ratio.  For engineers, there is one very interesting but, also very annoying, property of carbon fiber; the strength of the material depends on the orientation of its constituent graphite fibers, and can vary depending on the angle of the force being applied to a given sheet. 

    Due to its ease of production and the availlability of its raw materials, exporting carbon fiber across space is usually not economically sound.  Though there are some [!1 trade circuits] over which carbon fiber trade can net merchants a profit.  Consequently, almost every developed world harbors its own domestic carbon fiber production industry.

pages.name: Mini Computers
pages.data: [Unwritten]

pages.name: Field Computers
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Info
    [!2] +Scrub

pages.name: Field Computers
pages.data:
css
    Field Computers are small, usually-durable computers which are either portable, or part of a portable system (such as a vehicle).  Field Computers are used as Flight Computers, Guidance Computers, Systems Management Computers, and many other in-the-field applications.

pages.name: Datec Scrub
pages.data:
css
┌───────────────────────────────┐
│Use Period........: 53-Present │
│Operating System..: MoTran, Any│
│Stock Processors..: TxA16D8 w/ │
│                    32KiB Cache│
│Stock Main Memory.: 128KiB QRAM│
│Stock Data Volumes: 128KiB PROM│
│Stock Input/Output: None       │
│Hardware Ports....: 4xUHB Port,│
│                    16-Bit MMA │
│Unit Cost.........: $470       │
│Power Requirement.: 17 Watts   │
│Manufacturer......: Datec      │
└───────────────────────────────┘

    The Datec Scrub is a small field computer designed and sold by [!1 Datec].  It's a small, cheap machine meant for driving light hardware systems.  The model is meant specifically for personal integrated systems.
    The model has no internal disk drive of any sort.  Instead, the machine contains one 128KiB chip of programmable ROM that can act as Firmware and/or read-only program code.  Despite this, an editable data volume can still be connected to the system via one of its exterior [!2 UHB] ports.  While the system itself is not able to write to its internal ROM, the ROM can be edited via the machine's 16-Bit [!3 Main Memory Access] port.
    
    This model is in a very compact form factor, fitting in a small box frame, measuring only 22 by 18 by 6 centimeters in size.  On the top of the Scrub's case, the largest face of the chassis, is "Datec Scrub" in large, engraved text justified to at the top.  In the bottom left of the top face is minimal information about the machine, such as unit serial number and model power requirements.�css
    As a final step in manufacturing, the Scrub's case is filled with an expanding, hardening, non-conductive foam.  While this makes the machine very difficult to repair, it greatly increases the unit's durability.  This, combined with the fact that it has no internal moving parts, means that it can stand up to great physical stresses; it's said that the model can "survive anything short of a bullet".  By default, a Scrub's internal ROM contains a copy of the [!4 MoTran] computer operating system.
    After manufacturing, units are sold and shipped to 3rd party producers, such as [!5 Atlas] or [!6 Outerweapon].  Upon arrival, individual Scrubs typically have their ROMs overwritten with proprietary code, firmware, and/or files.  After which, the Scrub is augmented with application-specific hardware, and re-sold by the 3rd-party company.

    Originally produced in 53, the Scrub has found popular use as a high-tolerance, general purpose, cheap field computer.  Since its inception, over 200 million units have been sold to companies all across the [!7 Silver Stream].  Even now, some 50-year-old units can still be found across the galaxy, still in working order.

pages.name: Ports and Cables
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Universal Hardware Bus
    [!2] +Main Memory Access

pages.name: Main Memory Access Cables
pages.data:
css
    A Main Memory Access Port (or just "MMA Port")  is a port on a computer that allows an external device to access a computer's [!1 Main Memory] as if the external device were one of the computer's own [!2 processor cores].  Typically, this is done through interfacing the port directly to a computer's [!3 Memory Space Controller].

    MMA Ports are commonly used to push graphics data to monitors, or other data-intensive applications.  MMA ports come in 16-bit, 24-bit, and 32-bit variants.  These variants are non-interchangeable.  MMA Ports use a plug-socket system, where the positive plugs of a cable is inserted into the negative sockets on devices.

pages.name: Other Weapon Modifications
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Shuvuran Ballistic System

pages.name: Shuvuran Ballistic System
pages.data:
css
┌─────────────────────────────────┐
│Common Use Period..: 81-Present  │ 
│Rating Changes.....: +5 Accuracy │ 
│                     -3 Precision│
│Unit Cost..........: $3500/Unit  │ 
└─────────────────────────────────┘

    The Outerweapon Shuvuran Ballistic System is an aiming assistance system named after a La'Foyan mountain predator.

    The system itself is composed of a targeting computer and a transparent HUD(Heads-Up Display) screen over the face of a user's helmet.  The HUD displays the ammo count of each weapon connected to the system.  The target computer is guided by two IR cameras mounted in the helmet, and a gyroscope and an accelerometer in the connected weapon.  The system uses infrared(thermal) light to idenfity targets.  In total, Shuvuran unit consists of a [!1 Scrub] field computer, two [!2 UHB]-connected IR cameras, a transparent screen connected via the Scrub's [!3 MMA port], and a proprietary UHB cable that connected to any compatible weapon.

    The system manifests as a small targeting computer affixed with adhesives to the back of a user's helmet.  A thin, transparent, 256 by 384 pixel, black-and-white screen (which offers no armor advantage), is placed in front of the user's face.  In order for the system to work, the user must also install both of the system's IR cameras on either side of their helmet.  Once the Shuvuran system is installed into a user's helmet, the user then needs to calibrate the system to account for discrepancies in placement of the IR cameras and/or HUD screen.  After calibration, the system is ready for use (instructions for calibration are provided in the Shuvuran's manual).�css
    On the HUD screen, the user is presented with numbered bounding boxes of all IR-emitting(meaning warm) objects in the user's line of sight.  After showing the user the bounding boxes of all sources of Infrared Light, user can then select one of them for the system to target (specfically, the target is selected using buttons on the attached weapon's grip).  The Shuvuran's guidance computer's IR telemeter then determines the distance to the target and its position relative to the gun.  

    Many militaries across the GCP have expressed interest in the system, but a combination of cost and worries over national sovereignty and dependance toward la'foy have prevented the system from getting widespread adoption outside of the La'Foyan military.  The system is sold directly by Outerweapon at a cost of $3500 per unit.  The system exist in two versions -- The original version grants a change of +3 to a weapon's accuracy and -3 to its precision and an updated version, made in 101PW, grants +5 acuracy and only -2 precision.

Special Information:
    The Shuvuran System only works with firearms specifically designed for Shuvuran compatibility

pages.name: Alpha Ballistic Revolver
pages.data:
css
┌──────────────────────────────┐
│Use Period......: 71-Present  │
│Weight..........: 1.2 Kg      │
│Ammunition......: Outer-Gyros │
│Clip Capacity...: 8 Rounds    │
│Shots/3 seconds.: 3           │
│Loading Type....: Semi-auto   │
│Reload Time.....: 2rounds/3sec│
│Accuracy Rating.: 4           │
│Precision Rating: 2           │ 
│AP Rating.......: Variable    │ 
│Damage Type.....: Ballistic   │ 
│Manufacturer....: Outerweapon │ 
└──────────────────────────────┘


    The [!1 Outerweapon] Alpha Ballistic Revolver is a high-end revolver for wealthy consumers and militaries.  An internal gyroscope can be embedded into the handle to allow for connecting the weapon to a [!2 outerweapon`s Shuvuran Aiming System] for higher accuracy. 

    The gun's chassis is coated with lightweight [!3 carbon fiber] and offers an elegant, streamlined design.  The ammo cylinder of the revolver can be swapped out in its entirety faster reloading.  Outerweapon sells extra revolver cylinders for 150$ per cylinder.  When replacing the cylinder, reloading the entire clip only takes about three seconds.

    The Shuvuran-compatible version of the rifle features a circle pad under the thumb for control of the [!2 Shuvuran targeting system], as well as a medium-large rail on the top of the barrel allow for [!4 weapon modifications].  Outerweapon offers a price of 2100$ per-unit for the revolver, with an extra 500$ for Shuruvan compatibility.�css
    The ammo used by the revolver, the [!5 outer gyro], is self-propelled.  Thanks to this, the gun has virtually no recoil.  The use of a gyrojet ammo is the reason why the weapon sports highly-recognisable exhaust vents on the sides of its barrel.  Individual Outer-gyro ammo costs 12$ per round on average.

    The revolver has been produced since the inception of the Outerweapon company, and is cited as one of the the reasons why the company has become a prominent manufacturer within the [!6 GCP].

Special information:
    Due to the self-propelled nature of the ammunition, the armor piercing power of the weapon follows the following rule:
    When fired, the AP rating of a gyro bullet starts at 1 and increases by 1 every 3 meters the bullet traverses in flight, up to a maximum of 6.

pages.name: Gyro Ballistic Rounds

pages.name: Gamma Assault Rifle
pages.data:
css
┌─────────────────────────────┐
│Use Period......: 73-Present │
│Weight..........: 1.7 Kg     │
│Ammunition......: Outer-gyro │
│Clip Capacity...: 25 Rounds  │
│Shots/3 seconds.: 5          │
│Loading Type....: Full-Auto  │
│Reload Time.....: 3s         │
│Accuracy Rating.: 5          │
│Precision Rating: 4          │ 
│AP Rating.......: Variable   │ 
│Damage Type.....: Ballistic  │ 
│Manufacturer....: Outerweapon│ 
└─────────────────────────────┘

    The Gamma Assault Rifle is one of the jewels of [!1 Outerweapon’s] production; its sleek design, utilizing [!2 carbon fiber], is intended to make the weapon appear alien and futuristic, even more than 10 years after its release.  If the rifle is bought directly from Outerweapon, a buyer can pay $1,000 added cost to have the handle and foregrip shaped custom to its owner (this grants a rating bonus +1 Accuracy when being used by the owner).  Due to the use of a gyrojet ammunition, the barrel is very light and short, and individual rounds are loaded with a bullpup mechanism.  Thanks to these two attributes, the rifle is exceptionally compact, with a length of 45 cm and light with a weight of 1.7 kg when unloaded. 

    This rifle was the first built with the Shuvuran system in mind, allowing for an easy and cheap integration of required Shuvuran components, like the gyroscope or the thumb pad.  A Medium-large rail is present on the top of the rifle to allow for [!3 weapon attachments].�css
    The rifle is sold at a price of $5000 per unit, with an added $300 for [!4 shuvuran] compatibility.  A Gamma Assault Rifle that was not manufactured with Shuvuran compatibility can be modified to be made compatible, but this is costlier and a more complex process.  Thanks to its precision and its exceptionally low-weight, this weapon is standard issue for some Special Ops ranks of the [!5 La`Foyan Military].


Special information:
    Due to the self-propelled nature of the ammunition, the armor piercing power of the weapon follows the following rule:
    When fired, the AP rating of a gyro bullet starts at 1 and increases by 1 every 3 meters the bullet traverses in flight, up to a maximum of 6.

pages.name: Currencies
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +GCP-Recognized Currencies [Stub]

pages.name: GCP-Recognized Currencies
pages.data:
css
    The following is a list of [!1 GCP]-recognized currencies.  With each listing is the currency name, its symbol [in square brackets] its abbreviation (in parenthesis), its value compared to Itascan Coin as of the year 73 P.W. {in curly brackets}, followed by the denominations it commonly comes in, what the currency is backed by, the nations in which this currency is generally accepted, and a description.
    
    Itascan Coins -- [$] (ITC) {$1 ITC = $1 ITC}
    Denominations: $0.25, $0.5, $0.75, $1, $5, $10, $25, $40, $100, $200, $1,000
    Backed by: [!2 Itascan Government]
    Jurisdictions: [!2 Itascus], [!3 Solar Union]
    Description:
        The ITC comes in three physical forms: a small (3cm by 5cm), cloth bill for denominations smaller than $1; a small (3cm diameter), brass coin for denominations between $1 and $25; and a medium (5cm diameter) stainless steel coin for denominations greater than $25.  Coins with values of $100 or greater are cast from stainless steel of a specific [!4 microstructure] to discourage counterfieting.
        Every denomination is labeled with its value in ITC and the year in which it was minted.  Units produced after 26 P.W. are adorned with small artwork depicting various events in [!5 Itascan history].  All Itascan Coins were minted on [!6 planetary Itascus] until 44 P.W. where they began federally-overseen production on all [!7 Itascan planetary territories].  All units manufactured after 44 P.W. are engraved with an image of the planet they were made on on the side opposite of the mark of its value.  The image of the planet is centered on the ground location of the mint where the coin was manufactured.�css
    La'Foyan Zenwanc -- [Þ] (ZWC) {Þ5.32 ZWC = $1 ITC}
    Denominations: Þ1, Þ2, Þ4, Þ8, Þ32, Þ48, Þ64, Þ256, Þ512
    Backed by: Silver
    Jurisdictions: [!8 La'Foy], [!9 Armalai]
    Description:
        ZWC coins are small (7cm height, 1cm diameter) cylinders made of various materials.  One end of the cylinder is stamped/embossed with its value in ZWC.  Originally, on ancient [!10 La'Foy], ZWC were backed by various metals -- the metal a denomination was backed by was that of its composition (ex. a ZWC made of copper would be equivalent to a certain amount of copper).  This was changed in the [!11 galactic 10s] as [!2 Itascans] (and their influence) arrived on La'Foy.  Modern ZWC are made out of Iron or Copper, and are backed by a single metal: Silver. 


    Solar Coins -- [$] (SUC) {$0.91 SUC = $1 ITC}
    Denominations: $0.1, $0.25, $0.5, $1, $5, $10, $25, $50, $100, $200, $1,000
    Backed by: [!3 Solar Union Government]
    Jurisdictions: [!3 Solar Union]
    Description:
        SUC units are very similar to ITC.  SUC units with a value of less than $1 are small (3cm diameter) coins made of polished cast iron.  Units with values from $1 to $50 are made of nickel-zinc alloy, and are slightly larger (4cm diameter).  Units with values of $100 and above are made of gold-plated steel, and are 6cm in diameter.  Each coin is labeled with its value on both sides, and is embossed with a select quote (related to Solar Union) history written in [!12 Unil] around the rim of both faces.
        Following in the footsteps of ITC minters, SUC coins with values greater than $25 are made of specific [!4 microstructures] of metal to discourage counterfieting starting in 47 P.W., but the Solar Union minters chose to use a microstructure that made the coins shimmer in light, but considerably reduced their structural integrity.  As well as switching to microstructured metal, SUC minted after 47 are stamped with a unique unit serial number.�css
    Armalite Credits -- [¤] (ARC) {¤2.41 - ¤4.69 ARC = $1 ITC}
    Denominations: Any, ¤1, ¤4, ¤8, ¤32, ¤64, ¤256, ¤512, ¤2048
    Backed by: Digital Credit
    Jurisdictions: [!9 Armalai]
    Description:
        Physical Armalite Credits, called "Tiles" in [!12 Unil] or "Shengwanc" in [!13 Nunwei], are small (7cm by 6cm), thin rectangles made of plastic or other light polymers that come in faded colors.   Credits are thick (1cm) at the rim, but inset and thinner (~4mm) further in; this is to allow credits to 'click' into eachother and stack -- the back face of any ARC neatly slots into the front face of any other since all denominations are the same size.  In the inset face of credit is its value written in [!13 Nunwei] numerics, with the same value written in [!12 Unil] numerics under it.  While standard denominations of credits come in, values of 1, 4, 8, 64, 256, and 512, other denominations of arbitrary values (ex 3, 5, 371) exist and are perfectly valid forms of credits.
        While ARC units come in a variety of colors, the color of an individual tile is determined by its value: ¤1 tiles are red, ¤4 tiles are orange, ¤8 tiles are yellow, ¤32 tiles are orange, ¤64 tiles are yellow, ¤256 tiles are green embedded with lime glitter, ¤512 tiles are blue embedded with cyan glitter, ¤2048 tiles are violet embedded with purple glitter, and tiles of arbitrary denominations are white.
        Along the top edge of a credit tile is two adjacent arrays of small plastic bumps and gaps, with each bump and gap spaced about a millimeter apart.  These arrays of bumps are for interfacing with automatic cashier machines.  The top-right array is 16-bit and encodes the tile's credit value, and the top-left array is 40-bit and encodes the tile's unique serial number.�css
        The value of an Armalite credit varies so much because it's an extension of the Armalite Controlled Digital Economy -- the majority of domestic Armalite funds exists digitally in the planet's [!14 Overnet] system, and is the defacto form of the currency.  Digital Armalite credits are simply called "Credits", or "Shengwan" in [!13 Nunwei].  The value of the Armalite Credit varies frequently and intentionally, controlled by the state.  While this is to keep the planetary economy stable, this has led some foriegn investors to see the Armalite economy as Unstable.


    Tuine Dyian'ye -- [Ð] (BTD) {Ð17.44 BTD = $1 ITC}
    Denominations: Ð1, Ð5, Ð10, Ð50, Ð100, Ð500, Ð1,000, Ð5,000, Ð10,000
    Backed by: [!15 Tuine Government]
    Jurisdictions: [!15 Bius Tu]
    Description:
        Tuine Dyian'ye (pronounced "de-en-ya") comes in two forms: bills and coins.  Dyian'ye with a value of Ð500 or less are made as wood-paper bills, while Dyian'ye with greater values are made as metal coins.  The Dyian'ye was originally backed by metallic gold, but it was changed to being backed by the Tuine Government in 62 P.W. after a brief instance of runaway inflation on [!16 planetary Bius Tu].
        Dyian'ye in bill form are made out of tough, thin wood-made cloth, and are 6.5cm by 13cm in size.  On bill Dyian'ye, the denomination's value in BTD is printed on the top right and bottom left of of the front side, with a small image of great Tuine invention at a cinematic angle in the middle.  Below the image is the date of the bill's printing.  On the back side of the bill is a larger image of that same invention, but at a different, usually more descriptive, perspective.  For example, on the Ð50 BTD bill images of the [!17 Syakyl spaceplane] -- one images of the ship in spaceflight on the front, and three images of the ship from the side, front, and top on the back.�css
        Coin Dyianye are all 6cm in diameter and made of Nickel.  On one face of the coin is its value and the year in which it was minted.  On the other is an embossed image of [!16 planetary Bius Tu], [!18 Osirja], or a species from the [!19 Beius vivotype].  Embedded in each nickel coin is a smaller, brass coin/circle in its center.  In larger denominations of coin, the brass inner circle takes up a larger proportion of the coin.  This is because, in ancient times, Tuine coins consisted of Iron with a Gold center.  Though in -11 P.W., as treasuries were enstated, the gold core of the coins was changed to gold-plated copper, becoming more of a symbolic token.  In 62, once the currency was no longer gold-backed, new coins were minted with brass in place gold or copper.
        
    
    Deorian Shenyak -- [ß] (DOS) {ß0.50 DOS = $1 ITC}
    Denominations: ß1, ß4, ß8, ß16, ß64, ß128, ß256, ß1024, ß2048
    Backed by: [!20 Deorian Government]
    Jurisdictions: [!20 Deoria], [!21 Ghillymede]
        Deorian currency comes in the form of either circular, 4-sided, or 8-sided coins, minted out of bronze, Sterling silver, or pure silver/gold alloy.  Each holds a small square hole in the center used for threading coins together for easy storage and transport.  All coins feature an image of a [!22 Deorian]'s antlers accompanied by an official seal on the front and the coin's value on the back, alongside other elegant engravings.

        8-sided coins are worth twice much as their 4-sided counterparts, an example being a 4-sided bronze coin being worth 4 Shenyaktik while the 8-sided is worth 8 Shenyaktik. Bronze is the least valuable of the coins, with Sterling silver coins being worth 16 times the value of their respective bronze counterparts, while silver-gold coins are worth 256 times their bronze counterparts, or 16 times the Sterling Silver variants.�css
    Gallean Galix -- [Ԙ] (GLX) {Ԙ1 GLX = $1.50 ITC}
    Denominations: Ԙ.25, Ԙ.50, Ԙ1, Ԙ2, Ԙ5, Ԙ10, Ԙ20, Ԙ50, Ԙ100, Ԙ1000
    Backed by: [!23 Gallean Government]
    Jurisdictions: [!23 Gallea], [!21 Ghillymede]
        Gallean currency has a uniform shape of a circle with a square hole punched through its center in all denominations, about 1cm thick and 5.5cm in diameter.  The center square has vertical indentations to easily create a stack using rods of a complementary shape.  The coins usually consist of a material core disk surrounded by a 2mm-thick outer edge, with the outer edge being a circular piece of metal, the square hole being made of the same outer metal. 
        The coin’s denomination is related to its material.  The Ԙ.25 unit has a copper metal and light-pink-hardened-glass core, Ԙ.50 has a copper metal and a darker-pink-hardened-glass core.  The Ԙ1 has a steel metal and a light-blue-hardened-glass core, the Ԙ2 has a steel metal and a dark-blue-hardened-glass core.  The Ԙ5 has a steel metal and a diluted-jade core, and the Ԙ10 has a stainless-steel-metal and a full-jade core.  The Ԙ25 has a stainless steel metal and a half-flint, half clear-hardened-glass core.  The Ԙ50 has a gold metal and a full flint core.  The Ԙ100 has a gold metal and am obsidian core.  And finally, the Ԙ1000 has platinum metal and a red obsidian core. 
        All denominations up to Ԙ25 are machine-engraved.  Denominations worth Ԙ25 and up are laser engraved.  These engravings are, official Gallean markings on the surrounding metal band stating ‘Official Gallean Currency’ in [!24 Gallean], the unit's denomination written on the core, a serial number wrapped around the square, and authentication holes that burrow into the core at various depths.

    Lewis Jacobs was born in [!1 Kullmia] two years after the invention of [!5 warp drive] as his parents were travelling abroad.  Both of his parents were [!6 Ameniran] nationals, and the newborn Lewis Jacobs was officially granted Ameniran citizenship when his parents returned home with him later that year. 

    Lewis Jacobs was the Ameniran president during the later half of the [!8 Itascan World War], and was the first Itascan high president after Itascus' unification.  Jacobs died of [!2 IMBCG] of the heart in 47.

    [This article is a stub, you can help by expanding it]

pages.name: Pacemism
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Info

pages.name: Pacemism
pages.data:
css
    Pacemism is a belief system founded by the Ceiraz [!1 Deorians].  Historically, the [!2 Ceiraz], as a people, have been seen as more philosophically-oriented than other Deorian peoples of their time.  This led them to pave the way for Pacemism, the traditional Ceiraz religion and belief system, based off of ideas concieved by Ceiraz philosophers through meditation and speculation regarding how to live better lives during [!3 Deoria’s] Bronze to Iron Age.  Several aspects of the religion, however, culminated in the times before and after that of its initial founding.

    The primary focus of Pacemism is to improve its followers’ lives by providing guidelines for living peacefully, knowledgeably, and wisely.  This is to be achieved through frequent nightly meditation; having a desire for nonviolence, peace, and prosperity; being good-willed towards fellow life (especially other sapients and concious beings); maintaining balance in nature; and striving for "enlightenment", a term whose ultimate definition is considered different for each individual follower based off of what they wish to achieve through following the religion’s teachings.
    Typically, Pacemism imposes dietary restrictions; Pacemists are not to consume any immature animal, nor are they allowed to domesticate animals nor eat any animals that have been domesticated.  On a side note, cannibalism (or consuming any sapient) is also strictly prohibited.  In summary, Pacemists should not consume farmed animal products, animal products from immature animals, eggs, or people.  Also, Pacemists are to practice reserving the night for meditation and sleep only, thus, all food must be prepared and eaten in the day.�css
    Pacemists also practice a burial ritual involving dressing the recently deceased in fine clothing, seating them in a calm, quiet place, as though the corpse were meditating.  Those performing the ritual are expected to meditate into the night with the body.  The corpse is then left alone to "meditate" peacefully, only being visited occasionally during the night to be meditated with again as an act of mourning, if one wishes to do so.  Once the body begins to show signs of decay, the body is taken to a resting place.  In these resting places, small, upright, above-ground coffin-tombs are constructed.  These coffins are 1^3 to 2^3 cubic meters in size, being relatively spacious for a corpse.  The body is placed sitting upright in a wooden coffin, as if it were meditating.  The coffin is then surrounded in earthen clay then treated with fire to make it more resilient, as the resting places are meant to stay standing indefinitely.  Many wealthy Pacemists have ornate altars constructed in or outside of their tombs, while commoner Pacemists simply have their coffin-tombs, usually placed in large graveyards containing vast fields of other coffins.

pages.name: Ni̤fra̤v
pages.data:
css
┌──────────────────────────────────┐
│Group Name.........:Tribe         │
│Youngling Name.....:Calf          │
│Status.............:Safe          │ 
│Vivotype...........:Daerus        │ 
│Archetype..........:Humanoid      │
│Domestication......:Undomesticated│
│Intelligence Class.:General       │
│Lifespan...........:16±3.2 Years  │
│Time to Maturity...:4.2±0.5 Years │
│# Physical Sexes...:2             │
│Sexual Polymorphism:Low           │ 
│Procreation Method.:Interactive   │ 
│Diet/Resource Input:Herbivorous   │
│Respiratory Gas....:Oxygen        │
│Weight.............:47±4Kg        │
│Height.............:149±6cm       │
│Thermal Range......:295±3K        │ 
│Blood Volume.......:4+(0 to 1)L   │ 
│Min Conscious Blood:3L            │
│Top Speed..........:21±2m/s       │
└──────────────────────────────────┘

    The Deorian Tribal Deer, called the "Ni̤fra̤v" in [!1 Deorian], or just the "Deer", is a common life form found natively on [!2 Deoria].  It is a herbivorous mammal that partially resembles a [!3 Ceiraz Deorian] in appearance and structure, with the addition of long, silky, wool which it grows out completely before cold seasons approach their area of habitation (as opposed to a [!3 Ceiraz Deorian]’s thicker, poofier coat of fur), allowing it to stay warm in the mountains and forest highlands from which it originated.  The wool begins to shed upon the end of the cold season, and is usually completely gone by mid-Spring.�css
    Even though the Ni̤fra̤v normally sprints quadrupedally (on all fours) to maneuver quickly, the Tribal Deer also has the interesting ability to slowly waddle on its hind legs whilst being able to grab objects with its front appendages (making them act as primitive arms).  The creature is genetically similar to the sapient Deorian races, and similarly displays intriguing levels of intelligence, even sometimes found manipulating items with its "hands" and utilizing them as tools or giving them to other creatures, even Deorians, as gifts.  A few common examples of this would be the usage of sticks as weapons to fend off predators and the occasional occurrence of a Tribal Deer plucking wild berries from bushes and handing them to nearby Deorians.

    The Deorian Ni̤fra̤v displays a high level of sociability in general, and they are typically seen in large groups of around ten to fifty, resembling tribes.  When two tribes of Deer meet in nature, they typically merge into one larger tribe if there are no major barriers between them.  These tribes of Ni̤fra̤v live together in a seemingly-unmoving section of a forest, performing their daily activities together, such as gathering edible vegetation, defending themselves and eachother from predators or hostiles (such as the [!4 Deorian Savage Isf], which sometimes compete with the Tribal Deer for territory), mating, and sometimes even more complex activities such as trading food and items with one other (and sometimes even with local Deorians).

pages.name: Qi Energy
pages.data:
css
    Qi Energy is energy in the form of [!1 Charged Qi particles].  Qi Energy is a type of potential energy, which can easily be transformed into light, thermal, electric, chemical, or kinetic energy as the Charged Qi Particles discharge.  Qi Energy can be produced by certain chemical reactions, electrical means, and interacting with light (meaning chemical, electrical, or light energy can be converted to Qi Energy).  Qi Energy is measures in "Chella", often abbreviated as "Chells" or "Cs".  One Chella is equal to 32 kibijoules, or 32,768 joules, of stored Qi Energy.

    Qi Energy is an essential part of [!2 Biology], as most all living creatures use Qi Energy to store energy and maintain homeostasis (primarily as a potential source of heat).  It is similarly used in most types of batteries across the [!3 GCP], with the Qi Energy being used to store power.

    Qi Energy can "manifest" in and propagate through material in an almost identical manner to Heat Energy.  Qi Energy spreads through contact, from high concentration to low concentration, until the Qi Energy in an area has reached equilibrium.  Though, Qi Energy generally propagates through substances and materials many times faster than Heat Energy (not always, as a material's Qi Conductivity is often not proportional to its Heat Conductivity).
    All materials have a "Qi Conductivity", which determines the rate at which Qi Energy flows within it.  Substances such as Chellinsuphin (proteins that keep Qi Energy from escaping from a creature's skin) have a low Qi Conductivity, and are considered Qi Insulators.  Substances such as many metals and many forms of crystals have a high Qi Conductivity, and are considered Qi Conductors.

pages.name: Classes of Qi Entity Functions
pages.data:
css
    There are four classes of Qi Entity flavors, those being "Structum", "Actuatum", "Sentium", and "Logicum".
    The Structum class of qi entities mainly deal with the flow of energy throughout spells.
    The Actuatum class covers ei entities that create a force or effect in their environment, such as creating heat, light, force, or pressure.
    Sentium are qi entities that can "sense" properties of their local environment, and can be seen as the opposite of Actuatum.  Sentium entity flavors include detecting heat, EM radiation (which includes visible light), density, and other things.
    Logicum is used for logic within qi entities, such as enabling/disabling other qi entities, and is usually used for wiring from Sentium entities to Actuatum entities which allows for the creation of very complex spells.

pages.name: Config Cards
pages.data:
css
    Config Cards (also called Data Cards) are small, thin, electronic cards, typically made of metal, hard polymers, or occasionally enamel.  Config Cards are small, commonly being about 4 by 7 centimeters with a thickness of 1.6 milimeters.  Config Cards have many uses, but their most promiment use is as small ROMs, the cards themselves being used as personal ID cards or member cards.  On the bottom face of the card, along one of the short edges, are 28 electrical contacts meant to interface with a Config Card Interface.  On the top face of the cards is usually some branding, labeling, or other visual elements.
    
    Config Card Interfaces provide a small amount of power to an inserted Config Card, and allow a computer or other device to read the data on the card.  For example, if someone inserted a Credit Card (a type of Config Card) into the interface, a computer could read the cardholder's banking information.  Physically, Config Card Interfaces have a small slot in them about the width and thickness of the card, into which a Config Card should be inserted.
    
    The most common use of Config Cards is as Electronic Keys or Credit cards.  Config cards can be also used for small amounts of memory (RAM, as opposed to ROM), which has its own applications.  These cards are considerably durable and incredibly cheap to produce, usually being made through [!1 Qi-Induced Microstructuring], which is very cost-effective.
    
    Config Cards were originally invented on [!2 Gallea] in 22 and were made to be inserted into industrial machines in order to give them different configurations (hence the name).  As Config Cards were introduced to the rest of the galaxy in the following years, they were adapted to the various applications we know today, making them very popular.

pages.name: Itascan Unity Day
pages.data:
css
    Itascan Unity Day is [!1 Galactic Calendar] holiday happening every galactic year on the second day of SiltCrest, the tenth month of the galactic year.  This day marks Amora's surrender in the year 10 P.W. in the [!2 Itascan World War].

    Unity Day is primarily celebrated on [!3 Planetary Itascus], and is celebrated to smaller extents in [!4 other Itascan territories].  The holiday is a multicultural celebration, celebrating [!5 the different cultures of pre-war Itascus] just about everywhere across the planet.  On the [!6 Grand Expo Grounds] in the Itascan Capital, a Multicultural Festival and parade are held, drawing thousands annually.

    The holiday was made a national holiday in 13 P.W. by the planetary Itascan Government in order to promote unity and raise appreciation for the outcome of the war.

pages.name: Spoofball
pages.data:
css
    Spoofball is a sport generally considered to be the "National Sport of [!1 Itascus]".  The sport features two teams of sixteen players, playing in a "Spoofball Pit," a 40x20 meter recessed court with walls at a 65 degree incline, and 4 goal hoops, two each on the far sides which the teams try to aim the Spoofball into.  These goals are about 80 cm wide.  The court is divided into four even slices, indicated via lines on the floor -- for each half of the court, the inner segment is called the "fray", and the outer segment, which holds the goals, is called the "base".
    The sport is played with "Spoofball Gloves," which are hardened gloves designed to stop players from grabbing the ball or injuring their hands during play, and a 30-cm-wide inflatable rubber ball.  Teams are to sort themselves into two groups of eight, becoming the 'front' and 'back' half-teams; the front group occupies the Fray segment of the court, playing offensively, while the back group occupies the Home, playing defense.  The object of the game is to put the spoofball into one of the other team's goal hoops by punching at the ball, no grabbing allowed.  If and whenever the ball leaves the court, the ref may throw it (typically haphazardly) back into the fray along the center line on the court, continuing play.  The same applies whenever the ball comes to rest on the floor, as in the ref is allowed to interfere.  Though, repeated, biased interference from the ref may disqualify a game, so such activity is rare.  In Professional games of spoofball, however, the ref is only allowed to touch the ball if it leaves the court.�css
    Spoofball is incredibly popular on Itascus, first invented by street children during the [!2 Itascan Unification War].  16 children, in two teams of 8, would wear leather gloves in a dried out culvert or crater and vied to hit balls past eachother.  In fact, it's rumored that the original Spoofball Pit was a crater left by artillery during the war.  Later, the parents of those children took note of the game, refined the sport by recording the roles, and started sharing it, thus "Spoofball" -- a spoof on the childrens' game -- was created.
    Competitive Spoofball teams may often break out in fights over things such as accusations of cheating, accidents, and sometimes just over bad blood from in (or out of) the pit.  This behavior is technically disallowed in professional play, but it is rarely stopped unless severe, only penalized.  Due to the fairly isolated environment of the "pit," fights are often allowed to play out without interruption; typically, the only person allowed to enter the pit is the referee, who is usually underequiped to break up fights of more than a few players.  This behavior gave Spoofball the reputation of a heavy contact sport, and caused the phrase "A game of spoofball broke out" to gain popularity as a figurative way of saying there was a brawl.

pages.name: Votoids
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Fìe - "Deorian Wheat"

pages.name: Deorian Wheat
pages.data:
css

┌─────────────────────────────────┐
│Group Name.........: Field, Sheaf│
│Youngling Name.....: Sprout      │
│Status.............: Safe        │
│Vivotype...........: Daerus      │
│Archetype..........: Votoid      │
│Domestication......: Domesticated│
│Intelligence Class.: Responsive  │
│Lifespan...........: 1.35±0.2 yrs│
│Time to Maturity...: 1.25±0.1 yrs│
│# Physical Sexes...: 1           │
│Sexual Polymorphism: N/A         │
│Procreation Method.: Passive     │
│Diet/Resource Input: Photovorous │
│Respiratory Gas....: C02         │
│Weight.............: 0.4±0.2kg   │
│Height.............: 115±18cm    │
│Thermal Range......: 295±22K     │
│Blood Volume.......: N/A         │
│Min Conscious Blood: N/A         │
│Top Speed..........: N/A         │
└─────────────────────────────────┘

    Deorian wheat, called "Fïs" in [!1 Deorian], is a tall, grain-bearing grass plant that grows natively on [!2 Deoria].  Its grains make up many staple foods on Deoria and Deorian worlds, and the plant is farmed on massive scales on such planets.  When in its developmental stages, the wheat appears a bright emerald color.  Once the wheat has blossomed and ripened, it is usually a lighter, more muted shade of green.  The grains, when crushed into flour or meal, make for a light green powder which has numerous applications, primarily in cooking food.

    Deorian wheat is the domesticated form of a type of wild grain that would’ve grown out in the vast Deorian grasslands in ancient times.  There is considerable historical evidence that shows that grain in general has been harvested since long before the beginning of written history, perhaps even having served as nutrition for an ancestor of the Deorian species as a whole.  It is believed that Deorian wheat was first cultivated by an ancient civilization that occupied an area that is now a part of [!2 Milland].�css

    The grain was originally ground into a coarse meal which would have either been boiled down with water into a thick porridge -- potentially sweetened with pieces of fruit or berries -- or simply mixed with water to form a lean dough, rolled out to be thin, and baked in the residual heat of a recently-used clay oven to make an unleavened flatbread.  This flatbread would’ve likely been consumed alongside a roasted fowl or [!3 Isf], or, alternatively, toasted a little more until hard and dry and used as a travel food.
    
    It is theorized that yeast (or yeast-like cultures of microbe) was first cultivated by accident using Deorian wheat, potentially when an individual left uncooked porridge to sit during a warm season.  Regardless of origin, the discovery of yeast was revolutionary for ancient Deorian cuisine; soon, bread was almost always baked with the addition of a yeast culture by most advanced agrarian civilizations.  As time progressed, the usage of Fi̤s flour/meal became more and more widespread and diverse, soon being used for all sorts of culinary applications, from historical breads and porridges, to gravies and sauces to pastries.
    
    Apart from being used in food, Fïs is also used as feed for many domesticated animals.

    Evidently, wild [!3 Isfžr] are drawn to this plant's grains, and have frequently posed a problem for Deorian wheat farmers, who often manage to discover burrows near or in their fields.  To combat this problem, farmers would’ve traditionally "hired" [!4 Ni̤fra̤v] to help keep watch over their fields while they weren’t around. In modern times, the preferred solution is to simply coat the crops in pesticide which are highly effective at deterring Isfžr, but are mostly harmless to Deorians, Ni̤fra̤v, and most common farm animals.  The pesticide can be washed off after harvesting by simply soaking the harvested grains in water for a few hours.  This is typically done before the grain is sold or used.

pages.name: Tunnel Sites
pages.data:
css
    A Tunnel Site, also called a "Wormhole Website", is any website of which every connection to the surface internet must go through non-government [!1 quantum nodes].  This means that there is no physical radio or wire trail between the user and the website's server, because, if you have one end of a quantum node connection, there is no way you can use it to figure out the location of the other end.  Typically, this is done to keep the location of a webserver secret in order to maintain anonymity or even to evade authorities.

    The largest tunnelsite available on the galactic internet is [!2 Manymoon], which uses its tunnelsite status to dodge regulation regarding hatespeech and restricted information.

Gallean Legal Code
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Gallean Space Traffic and Threat Detection System

pages.name: Gallean Space Traffic and Threat Detection System
pages.data:
css
    Unlike most other governments in the [!1 GCP], [!2 Gallea] has a very regimented space traffic protocal that adds on to that of other GCP nations.  This system is known as the Gallean Space Traffic and Threat Detection System, or "STTDS".  This system was created during the [!3 Armament Era of Gallean history] in the year 52 as a toggleable modification of transmitters standard to the GCP at that time.  Transmissions sent from these units are encrypted and all documents regarding it’s specific details are confidential and classified to the general public.  A STTDS transponder turns on and transmits automatically when within Gallean space.  

    The STTDS transmitter must be turned on within Gallean space, and lawfully required on all ships sold, flown into, or manufactured in Gallean space and territories.  All ships detected without it are to be inspected immediately and failure to report in for inspection will incur hefty fines or even impoundment of the vessel.  If a ship is detected in Gallean Space without one of these transponders, it will be forced to land/dock, and cannot legally take off until the transponder is installed.  If the ship owner refuses to install a STTDS transponder, they are required to remain grounded indefinitely or leave the Gallean jurisdiction entirely.�css
    The workings of the STTDS system that are known to the public work by a series of Radar/Radio stations within Gallean space ping every single ship detected, the ping then turns on the transmitter if off and it sends information to the station, said station then transmits it to relays(if needed), that then bring the signal to Gallean data servers that monitor every single ship within Gallean Space.  Data known to be transmitted by STTDS transponders includes: [!4 Callsign], ship model, current heading, verified destination, Gallean registration, age, name of the ship, crew count, cargo description, date of last inspection, spacial location, and even reactor status (if applicable).  

    A STTDS system must be installed at a Gallean forward registration location on foreign planets and stations en route to Gallean space.  Said system can be installed at 0 cost to the owners of a ship, at the expense of the Gallean Government.

    Any tampering of the STTDS transponder within a ship, upon detection, will result in an emergency ping, which will be picked up by any relay station in range.  This is because STTDS system hardware is a state secret of the Gallean State.

pages.name: Gallean Military
pages.data:
css
    The Gallean military is separated into 2 twin branches, the Gallean Fleet by the official name of [!1 Gallean Fleet Command] (GFC), and the Army by the official name of [!2 Gallean Land Command] (GLC).  Within Gallea, their abbreviations are usually reduced to FC and LC respectively.  The Military, while having a government branch of its own, is only permitted to take care of military responsibilities laid out by the state, and cannot exercise much power outside of martial law.  The two branches co-operate the "Marine Forces" (MF), designed to deploy and control shock troops to establish offensive lodgements with combined command.  While exact number is confidential, estimates put the headcount of the combined Gallean forces at about 14 million.

    The current doctrine of the Military is one of "quality over quantity", with highly-advanced technologies on the cutting edge of what’s possible being used to outfit a proportionally small force.  However, while maintaining quality, it stockpiles large amounts of near-cutting-edge weapons as well as training soldiers and officers to do 2 ranks above themselves.  For example, promising privates recive training in some skills usually reserved for captains or commanders in addition to normal training, so that they may more smoothly fill those positions as the military ranks are expanded.  This is done in case the Gallean military is called on for war, so that it will easily be able to maintain quality of arms while raising a huge force.

pages.name: Untitled
pages.data:
css
    The Gallean Land Command (GLC) is the most numerous of the twin branches during peacetime.  Most Gallean numbers are unknown and confidential leaving it’s true size to speculation.  The Branch has sub branches Government Guard, Frontier Guard, Military Police, the Back Guard, Air Guard, and the Strategic Strike Group.  The branch can expand during wartime to include an Army Corps sub branch that would be manned by the officers of the Strategic Strike Group.  

    The Government Guard is the Elite force of the Land Command which protects and Guards government buildings, facilities, monuments, and landmarks.  Each section is a Contingent made of 5-10k Galleans, Contingents are split into Sector Patrol made up of 2,500 Galleans.  Each Patrol is divided into Defense Groups made up of 500 Galleans each.  Each of these Defense Groups are divided by Battalions of 100 each.  Battalions are then divided by squads of 10 which can be each specialized to the needs of the battalion.  
    The Frontier Guard are the primary peacekeepers of frontier worlds.  Toughened and rough, these enforcers usually work in squads of 5 to 1.  They operate under frontier commands that vary on the planet, population, geography, and necessity.  The Military police are the police of every branch, they root out corruption, unethical behavior, treason, and even war crimes.  This branch mostly works in divisions that are comprised of 5,000 operatives, and have subdivisions of 1,000 each known as Subversion Detection groups.  These will then be divided into groups of 100 that are attached to other branches known as Squadrons.�css
    The Back Guard is the logistical core of any GLC operation.  There are few specified structures of this branch, as it follows the most flexible doctrine of all the branches.  Its divided into 1,000-member corps of Gallean operatives, specified and reorganized to any needed necessity for a current or planned operation.  Some corps are engineer corps, logistic corps, transport corps, etc..
    The Air Guard is the Air Supremacy division of the Land Command and oversees all terrestrial air operations.  The largest section of Air Guard is 100-vehicle wings, comprised of 20 5-vehicle squadrons.  Perhaps the simplest of all the branches, it uses time-proven tactics to effectively gain supremacy, commit ground support, decimate supply lines and infrastructure, and protect the boots on the ground.  

    Strategic Strike Group is the most varied of all subbranches of the LC, It contains the Armor Corps, and the Strategic offense Corps.  This entire section can be expanded into the Army Corps during times of full war.  The Armor Corps is made of multiple Corps, with 5-10 divisions each.  Divisions are made up of ~4,000 vehicles each.  That 4,000 is split with 1,000 Strategic groups, every 100 of those are split into battalions.  Battalions are split into groups of specific vehicles, with each one containing having a different cast of military or logistical vehicles.  The Strategic Offense Corps is composed of many subcorps, which are separated into divisions of about 50,000 Soldiers.  Those divisions are separated into 10,000-soldier Battle Groups.  Groups can be separated into 1,000 strong Legions.  100 soldier platoons make up those Legions.  Platoons are then separated into squads of 10.

pages.name: Gallean Fleet Command
pages.data:
css
    The Gallean Fleet Command (domestically referred to as the Grand Fleet Command) is the main arm of the military and enforces the rule of law in Gallean space.  This branch fills three roles in space: policing, defense, and offense.  The sub branches of the Galactic Fleet Command are as follows:  The Law Enforcement Armada, Planetary Guard, Astroport Defense Guard, and The Strategic Armada.

    The Law Enforcement Armada is the policing arm of the GFC and performs day-to-day patrols of every [!1 trade circuit] and the enforcement of the [!2 TTDS] system.  The exact structure of enforcers in each sector of Gallean space is different, but most sector patrols keep a similar structure.  Each Sector has multiple patrol subsections, a patrol contains a corvette and multiple gunships, often accompanied by squadrons of interceptors.
    The Planetary Guard act as the defense garrison of a given Gallean planet.  They provide assistance to ships in trouble within the sphere of influence of the planet they serve, as well as protecting against smuggling and piracy, which is their primary responsibility during peacetime.  Each planet within the Gallean jurisdiction has 15-40 active Patrol Ships in orbit at any given moment.  Patrol groups usually consist of a single destroyer, with a docked fighter-interceptor as an escort or boarding ship.
    The Astroport Defense Guard is the GFC contingent in charge of the protection of public and government [!3 Astroports].  There are currently about 20 Galleat Garrisons footsoldiers, dedicated to defending Astroports, with each heavily-trafficked Astroport housing a contingent of 1-6 fighters for protection.  Little is publicly known about this sub-branch.�css
    The Strategic Armada is the largest of all sub-branches in the GFC and has a "quality over quantity" approach when it comes to capital ships, but a "quantity over quality" approach when it comes to smaller fighters.  The Strategic Armada branch has 3 publicly-disclosed fleets.  In each fleet there are: 1-7 fighters carriers, 1-2 dreadnoughts, 1-3 Battle Cruisers, 1-2 Heavy Cruisers, and 1-4 Light Cruisers.  Each fleet has a complement of 40-100 small fighter craft and/or atmospheric bombers (primarily concentrated within the fleet`s carriers), capable of swarming enemy fleets.   Strike craft and bombers dropped into the atmosphere from spacecraft follow the same protocols as the Air Guard of the [!4 Gallean Land Command].  These three fleets are named "Fleet Shadow", "Fleet Obsidian", and "Fleet Magma".  The Strategic Armada follows a doctrine of strategic carrier supremacy, each carrier can split its carried fleet into organized, offensive strike groups.  The reason for the Strategic Armada’s size is due to the [!5 Armament Era] in which the shipyards of Gallea were in full throttle and it expanded the navy that was barely able to keep ganeimede into a titan of space.
