pages.name: Furstian Deorians
pages.data:
css
┌───────────────────────────────────┐
│Group Name.........:Party/Gathering│
│Youngling Name.....:Bet/Youngling  │
│Status.............:Safe           │
│Vivotype...........:Daerus         │
│Archetype..........:Humanoid       │
│Domestication......:N/A            │
│Intelligence Class.:Sapient        │
│Lifespan...........:27±10.4 Yrs    │
│Time to Maturity...:8±1.2 Yrs      │
│# Physical Sexes...:2              │
│Sexual Polymorphism:Moderate       │
│Procreation Method.:Interactive    │
│Diet/Resource Input:Biovorous      │
│Respiratory Gas....:Oxygen         │
│Weight.............:80±10Kg        │
│Height.............:160±10cm       │
│Thermal Range......:292±19K        │
│Blood Volume.......:6.3L           │
│Min Conscious Blood:4.3L           │
│Top Speed..........:2±0.3m/s       │
└───────────────────────────────────┘

    The Furstians are a sapient race, apparently originating from the craggy mountain ranges of the [!1 Deorian continent of Milland].  The species bears a B-type body, with digitigrade legs and well-furred bodies.  Furstian fur covers most of the body lightly and quite evenly, but grows out longer and thicker on the top of the head and around the groin.  The color of this fur can range from a variety of shades, most typically brown, black, white, gray, red, and/or cream, depending on the genetic makeup of the subject.  Furstians have four clove digits per each of their two hands along with four cloves on each foot.  Trailing from their backs are long, thick tails which are used primarily for balance when standing upright and for other various activities, such as communal huddling, cuddling, and unarmed combat.  Upon their heads, Furstians also bear two long, pointy, concave, front-facing, orientable ears, alongside a pair of boney antlers.�css
    Within their mouths, Furstian males have an iconic pair of long, sharp, lengthy canine teeth (though those of a female are just a bit smaller and slightly less prominent).  The noses and jaws of a Furstian protrude a noticeable distance from the rest of the face, forming a sort of muzzle.  Furstian sclerae are brown while their triangular irises may be of a variety of colors, depending on genetics.

    It is observed that Furstian leg muscles are quite well-defined and naturally well-toned, though a seamless explanation as to why is currently lacking, with the best theory claiming the need for leg strength in mountaineering.  Despite this, their top movement speed is still a bit lower than that of other bipedal species, as their legs are rather clumsy by nature; as previously stated, Furstians rely on their tails for bipedal support to some extent.  Some may cite a paradox pertaining to how Furstians supposedly have muscular frames for mountain climbing despite having slightly undexterous legs, which should theoretically discourage the traversal of rough terrain.  In reality, however, Furstians have been noted to naturally excel decently in mountaineering, in spite of their klutzy legs.

    Furstians are apparently biologically hardwired to be more sociable and amiable creatures.  Due to this, Furstians tend to grow to become excellent at efficient communication, and have a reputation for being very eloquent in delivering ideas and are just as good at receiving them.�css

    There has been much debate in the past over whether Furstians should be considered a race of [!2 Deorian] or as its own species.  Genetically speaking, Furstians do share more than 99% of their DNA with [!3 Ricefieldic Deorians], though the physical and psychological differences cannot so easily be ignored.  It is believed that Furstians are from an offshoot of a common ancestor shared with Ricefieldic Deorians, which somehow crossed into the far-fletched regions of Polensend and isolated their communities from other Deorians for a few eons, resulting in the creation of a unique branch.  As of now, the general consensus mandates that Furstians are, indeed, their own species, but are to be referred to as “Furstian Deorians” for semantic and political reasons.

    Despite this, Furstian Deorians can crossbreed with other Deorians and create offspring, called "Zgorians".  However, Zgorians are infertile due to Furstians and Deorians having different numbers of chromosomes.  Their expected lifespan is also reduced by about 3 years.

    An interesting fact to note: caffeine (a stimulant/pesticide present primarily in a particular family of roots originating from [!4 Itascus]) has aphrodisiac-like and intoxicating effects on the Furstian species, effects somewhat similar to those caused by [!5 Ceiraz] "aphroteasiac", but significantly amplified to the point of even causing dangerous and/or risky behavior.  If too much is ingested, the individual will begin to experience a euphoric high accompanied by mild delusions and the exhibition of extraordinarily inappropriate behaviors.  If a critical amount is metabolized, the subject may go into cardiac arrest and die.  Due to this, the production, sale, and consumption of any food or drink containing a non-negligible amount of caffeine among Furstians is well-regulated.

pages.name: Gallean Social Uplift Program
pages.data:
css
    The Gallean Social Uplift Program, or GSUP, is a strategic social welfare program operated by the [!1 Gallean government].  Its priority is the rapid development of under-developed regions on the planet of [!2 Gallea].  It took on the responsibilities of the [!3 Gallean Reconstruction Program] in the year -20 P.W. when it was reinstated and reformed into the GSUP.  The goal of the program is to create a globally balanced but regionally specialized economic situation on Gallea. 

    Every 2 [!2 Gallean years], the GSUP compiles a list of the most underdeveloped, poverty-stricken, unemployed, and unhealthy cities, towns, or even regions; this list is known as the Necessary Uplift Priority (NUP).  The GSUP then does a long process of calculating the costs of uplifting those locations.  After expenses have been calculated and plans drawn, the most severe areas on the NUP will get the necessary funding allocated and uplift will be initiated; this is done in a process of greenlighting the uplift of the most severe region, then greenlighting the next most severe until the necessary funds for the next most severely needed uplift on the NUP is too much for the project's funds.  The leftover funds that were deemed too little to fund a new uplift would be allocated as needed to the current uplifts.

    Uplifting, as defined by the GSUP charter, is the socio-economic improvement of a poor region/location to where the average per capita wealth is above $20,000 [!4 ITC] a year.  Uplifting occurs in phases: the 1st phase is infrastructure, the 2nd is public transport, the 3rd is strategic stimulus. 

    In the 1st phase, infrastructure for transport, water, electricity, gas, etc., is repaired, then expanded within the region.  Thanks to the successes of the GRP, this phase is normally very complete and is still a part of the GSUP to ensure that nothing is missed.�css
    In the 2nd phase, comprehensive networks of public transport, from buses to monorails to even subways are planned and developed.  Local, interregional, and global routes are then connected with the transport system.  The entirety of the system is free for Galleans to use and has been shown to improve the ability for Galleans to commute while reducing costs.  After GSUP has created these transport options, the responsibility of maintaining and operating them is transferred to the [!5 Gallean Transit Authority], with whom they will be upkept and expanded with time. 

    In the 3rd phase, strategic stimulus, local companies and corporations alike receive incentives to set up shop in the region being focused on, or to expand their pre-existing operations.  The exact industries focused on depend on the region itself: some regions may have a strong tradition of film, for example, and as such the GSUP will focus on the local film industry.  If, instead, the area is perhaps rich in minerals, mining companies get the priority.  The intention is not to create balanced local economies, but specialized ones, each depending on another regional economy to create a sense of unity throughout the planet. 

    Not every uplift will follow these phases exactly, and most differ in at least one way, depending on the individual needs of a region or township.

pages.name: Tyventian Meatball Soup
pages.data:
css
┌──────────────────────────────────────────┐
│Type of Food.......: Tyventian Noodle Soup│
│Time Period........: 50-Present           │
│Special Ingredients: Meatballs, fries     │
│Preparation Needs..: Heat                 │
│Unit Price.........: $3-$8                │
│Servings per Unit..: 1-2                  │
│Unit Package.......: Can                  │
│Serving Mass.......: 400-700g             │
│Serving Calories...: 300-500 Calories     │
│Nutrient Sources...: Fat, Protein, Carbs  │
│Consumption Setting: Causal, Recreation,  │
│                     Home, Street         │
│Producer...........: Various              │
└──────────────────────────────────────────┘

    [!1 Tyventian noodle soup] has been consumed on [!2 Kayan] since the planet’s ancient times, but more recent interactions with extraterrestrial civilizations have brought about a plethora of modern variations on the traditional dish.  During the 50’s, [!3 Itascan] xeno-cuisine researchers arrived on [!1 Kayan] to study and record the culinary cultures present on the planet.  Returning to [!4 Itascus], they brought back the ancient recipe, and it was shared amongst various cooks, corporations, and food scientists around the globe.  Despite the prominence of seafood on Itascus, however, the classic snails and other Tyventian seafood options were not very palatable to most, and the process of de-snailing the shells was rather foreign to many younger Itascans, especially to those who lived far inland or in mountainous regions.  Thus, the snails were commonly replaced in Itascan culinary settings; one of the most common replacements for the snails other than native mollusks is Itascan meatballs with [!5 Tyventian] seasoning, and the dish is almost always accompanied with fries at most restaurants.�css
    Tyventian meatball noodle soup, alongside the other Itascanized variations of the traditional dish, is a landmark of Itascan-Tyentian cultural exchanges.  Many Itascan-Tyventian enclaves on Itascus use the dish as an icon of their dual-heritage.

    While the dish is consumed by all social classes, its canned form (minus the fries, which cannot be effectively canned with the soup) was made to appeal to the working class, serving as a quick and easy-to-prepare meal for those who have little time to prepare the soup the traditional way, or for those who lack the money to purchase all the ingredients necessary to make the dish in its entirety.  The soup is also typically seen being sold by Tyventian street food vendors in Tyventian enclaves.

    Native Tyventians have relatively mixed opinions on the meatball variation of their cultural dish: some enjoy the strong, rich taste of the Itascan-style meatballs and the addition of fries to the plating, while others see it as a bastardization of their beloved culinary traditions. 

    When preparing the meatball variation of Tyventian noodle soup, small meatballs (which may be made of any kind of meat, most popularly fish, shellfish, or livestock) are added to the broth as it simmers instead of snails or chunks of shellfish being added nearing the end of the cooking time.  The meatballs add a stronger meaty flavor to the broth and the noodles.  As previously mentioned, fries are also usually served with the noodles, commonly seen simply being piled on top of the bowl.  Many are fond of soaking the fries in the soup, which makes the fries taste a little sweet and spicy.

pages.name: Pageenda Pepay Plant
pages.data:
css
┌─────────────────────────────────────┐
│Group Name.........:Forest/Bunch     │
│Youngling Name.....:Sapling          │
│Status.............:Safe             │
│Vivotype...........:Itaus            │
│Archetype..........:Arboid           │
│Domestication......:Domesticated     │
│Intelligence Class.:None             │
│Lifespan...........:2±1 Yrs          │
│Time to Maturity...:0.32±0.03 Yrs    │
│# Physical Sexes...:3                │
│Sexual Polymorphism:None             │
│Procreation Method.:Interactive      │
│Diet/Resource Input:Photovorous      │
│Respiratory Gas....:Oxygen           │
│Weight.............:401±44kg         │
│Height.............:3±0.3m           │
│Thermal Range......:292±10k          │
│Blood Volume.......:N/A              │
│Min Conscious Blood:N/A              │
│Top Speed..........:N/A              │
└─────────────────────────────────────┘

    The Pageenda Pepay is a short and thin tree standing at around 3m tall populating the coastlines and islands of [!1 Itascus].  The trunk of the Pageenda Pepay tree is notably barren of any leaves or plumage, with a strange “platform” of branches forming just underneath the fruit.  It has a dozen simple mucronate leaves on its top, originating from the centre of the trunk; this is believed to have the purpose of being exposed to as much sunlight as possible and to channel water to its base.  The Pageenda fruit is large, heavy, and yellow, and when cracked open, has an orange-ish flesh with dozens of small, marble-sized seeds spread out across the entire plant.  The plant’s outer skin has two distinct phases: a soft and hard phase.  The hard phase spans from the germination to maturity of the fruit, after which the skin softens and becomes easier to crack or puncture.  The fruit is noticeably tasteless; however, its smell has been defined as very fragrant, and thus has been utilized by Itascan soapmakers for centuries.  The fruit itself weighs 2.5 to 3.5 kg.�css
    The history of the Pageenda Pepay dates back to prehistoric times, before the evolution of the modern [!2 Itascan species] as we know it.  During that time, the Pageenda family contained hundreds of different Pageenda species.  However, an unknown bottleneck in about -100,000,000 P.W. caused nearly all of them to go extinct, with the exception of two species.  One is the Pageenda Pepay, and the other is the Pageenda Magna.  Many of the defining features of the Pageenda Pepay originated from this bottleneck, wherein the need to specialize to a specific niche became necessary for the continued survival of the species.  It is believed that an endangered third Pageenda species existed until 17 P.W. but died out due to the environmental effects of the [!3 Itascan World War]; it is unknown if this is true, however, or if it was simply a different misclassified plant species that had not been previously discovered.

pages.data:
css
┌──────────────────────────────┐
│Date Started: 18/1/103        │
│Date Ended..: 18/1/103        │

└──────────────────────────────┘

    The Battle of Grevaore was one in a series of clashes between Urran security forces and striking communities on the contested world of [!1 Uterku] amidst the instability in the Urran Empire’s territories following [!2 The Battle of Armalai] and Karmine Jacobs’ disappearance.  Keen not to repeat their disaster at the hands of Union of Communal Mineworkers members at the [!3 Battle of the Salted Gates], the Urrans rushed in anti-riot infantry and light vehicles from several garrisons when the miners of the town of Grevaore downed tools and pledged their allegiance to the UCM.  The UCM also deployed thousands of its own members to the area in support of the strikers, thus setting up another violent confrontation between the two sides.�css
    During the battle, the UCM deployed their typical style of primitive mass assaults against Urran lines, using improvised weapons and throwing whatever they could get their hands on.  However, these tactics proved less effective than the UCM had expected them to be at Grevaore, because this time, they did not outnumber their opponents to the point where they could be overwhelmed.  Periodically, the Urrans opened up their lines for Uttan vehicles to rush through and fire on strikers using either lethal or non-lethal ammunition, although vehicles were forced to retreat back behind Urran lines quickly, lest they were disabled or overrun.  These two factors quickly gave the Urrans the upper hand, and subsequently led to victory around 10 hours after the UCM’s first charge.  Many UCM strikers retreated completely, while a few dozen locals made a fatal last stand in the town.  During the night following the battle, all the residents of Grevaore the Urrans could locate were arrested and hundreds of security personnel occupied the town to guarantee the loyalty of replacement miners.

    This battle was one of the more significant conflicts of the union strikes, as this was the first major defeat for the UCM.  The severe reprisals arguably prevented as many communities from joining the UCM, who otherwise would have supported them.  Indeed, the rate of communities joining the movement slowed down after the battle, although this certainly did not mark the end of bloody confrontations between the UCM and Urran forces.

pages.data:
css
┌───────────────────────────┐

│Loading Type....:Semi-Auto │
│Reload Time.....:9s        │
│Accuracy Rating.:9         │
│Precision Rating:4         │
│AP Rating.......:5         │
│Damage Type.....:Ballistic │
│Manufacturer....:Arcuiro   │
└───────────────────────────┘

    The Nui Banken (NBK) was invented by the Armalai Defense Company (Arcuiro) in 82 P.W. It was created during a push to make Armalai`s military less reliant on foreign weapons imports. Specifically, the Nui Banken was made to fill in the role of a long-range rifle.  The rifle is a Semi-Automatic Sniper System (SASS) bullpup rifle, chambered in .338 ACR.

    With a high-caliber round for long-range engagements, and medium railing on the top receiver for attachments, such as military-grade [!1 scopes], the BNK proves to be reliable and accurate from 200-1000 meters.  Its slow rate of fire is compensated for with high bullet speed.  The NBK`s reciever is made of forged steel, and its body is made out of a high-grade polymer.  The weapon costs $1,100 per unit to produce, and can be bought brand-new or on the civilian aftermarket for around $1,200 to $1,600 dollars [!2 ITC].

pages.name: Arkua Banken -- Lunar Storm Rifle
pages.data:
css
┌────────────────────────────┐
│Use Period......: 86-Present│
│Weight..........: 5.4Kg     │
│Ammunition......: 5.56x41mm │
│Clip Capacity...: 25 Rounds │
│Shots/3 seconds.: 4         │
│Loading Type....: Full-auto │
│Reload Time.....: 6s        │
│Accuracy Rating.: 6         │
│Precision Rating: 2         │
│AP Rating.......: 4         │
│Damage Type.....: Ballistic │
│Manufacturer....: Arcuiro   │
└────────────────────────────┘

    The Arkua Banken (AKBK) is an assault rifle developed by the Arcuiro Weapons Company in the year 86 P.W.  Arkua Banken roughly translates to "Lunar Storm Rifle", which is its name in [!1 Unil]. Its slow-but-steady 700-rpm fire rate, alongside its 25 round aluminum magazine, has proven capable of providing precise suppressive fire to the Armalite military.  The weapon is chambered in the intermediate 5.56x41mm ACR cartdridge, with decent stopping power at up to 500 meters.  After the [!2 Battle of Armalai], it had become popular among soldiers and civilians, being then adopted as a Standard Issue rifle, which is still in use to this day.  The weapon's frame is mainly composed of high-grade military polymer, with the internal mechanisms made out of titanium, giving the weapon a low failure and breakdown rate.  On the top of the weapon, between the ironsights, is a medium rail for attachments.  The gun costs around $1,000 to produce, and can be picked up on the civilian aftermarket for ~$1,200.�css
    Thanks to the great success of the NBK in 82 p.w, the rifle's inventor, Railu Miku, managed to gather the needed funds for the creation of a new, more complex weapon.  After 4 years of research and development, the first prototypes of the AKBK were finished, and quickly made available for purchase by [!3 GCP] militaries.  In the year 86, the Arkua Banken's first prototype was released, showing new techniques of manufacturing and materials, the AKB caught the eye of the [!4 Armalite] military as an alternative to the existing rifles.  However, it wasn't until the [!1 Battle of Armalai], in the year of 102, and after many modifications, that the rifle showed its showed its potential firepower.

pages.name: Salvatorism
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Overview
    [!2] +Innovillion/Gail
    [!3] +Yvest [Unwritten]

pages.name: Salvatorism
pages.data:
css
    Salvatorism is the most dominant religion on [!1 Itascus], and bears numerous denominations and sects with which many Itascans and non-Itascans alike identify.  The religion is thought to have been practiced ever since the beginning of civilization on Itascus itself, thus making it the oldest of Itascan belief systems.  Evidence suggests that the religion began in what is now the [!1 Kullmi Province], with a multitude of ancient manuscripts describing a religion very similar to modern Salvatorism.  Salvatorism spread to Ferika during Itascus' Late Antiquity through the development of long-distance trade routes and more advanced transportation technologies.  It became very popular within Ferika and eventually outgrew the pre-existing Ferikan religions, becoming the dominant belief system in both Kullmia and Ferika.

    Salvatorism is monotheistic, and all denominations universally agree on the existence of a single omnipotent deity who was responsible for the creation of the universe, though each denomination has its own understanding of what this god is like and how they must be honored and served.  This god is named "Jheiyah", but the diety is almost exclusively referred to as simply "God" or "The Lord".  Most denominations share the concept that this god is benevolent by nature, as is thus worthy of great praise and worship as a means of showing gratitude for the gift of existence.  The Salvatorist deity is worshipped by the majority of denominations through prayers, songs, participation in diet-related events, and occasionally sacrifice, though the latter two worship methods are less common across the denominations compared to the former.�css
    Salvatorists believe that their deity's sacred teachings and commands had been transcribed and compiled by mankind over many years in the distant past in the form of what is now known as the Great Gospel -- the final, definitive form of God's Word.  Salvatorists devote themselves to following the teachings written in this book as accurately as they can, believing that having faith in their god and following their god's teachings well would allow one access to the heaven post-mortem.  The concept of the afterlife to most salvatorists involves two extremes: Heaven, a beautiful utopia where loyal disciples are permitted to bask in the direct glory of their god for eternity; and Hell, a horrifying place devoid of anything one might consider "good" reserved for those who reject the deity's guidance; Salvatorist hell is usually depicted as a realm consisting only of a murky ocean with either no land or no surface entirely, and it is heavily implied that a part of hell's punishment is the inability to see or breathe.  Salvatorists believe that all humans are flawed and hellbound by default, and that following their deity's commands and teachings is necessary to even have a chance at earning a place in heaven.

    Salvatorists tend to conduct their worship in groups (as per tradition), and usually meet together at temples at the end of every [!2 Itascan week], as per the command of scripture.  Worship services usually consist of a preaching session, then a pious song and dance session, then a prayer session, before finally adjourning; some denominations also include a sacrifice session before prayer.  Authoritative figures, known as priests, orate the preaching sections, and in denominations where animal sacrifice is practiced, it is also the priest's job to kill and offer up the sacrifice to the deity.�css
    One very important figure in the Salvatorist religion was a fisherman named Innovis, who lived during Itascus' Classical Era, around 700 years before the invention of [!3 Warp Drive].  Innovis was a prophet who claimed to have been the Lord, Jheiyah, in human form.  This bold claim gave way to a huge turning point in the religion's continuity.  For context, it had been previously prophesied that such an event would happen: that their god would one day walk the world as a man amongst mankind to serve as a symbol of their salvation.  Many believed that Innovis was this man,  especially due to the various supernatural acts he had allegedly committed throughout his ministry, and they celebrated the arrival of their savior.  Others argued that Innovis was a fraud and set out to prove his blasphemy.  As it is written, just after Innovis had reached his peak popularity, he was killed via several stab wounds from fishing spears by a group of assassins consisting of some members of a regional mercenary group, who had been hired by Innovis’ opposition.  The controversies of Innovis' life and death established a great divide in the various Salvatorist doctrines which still exists to this day, as theologists continue to argue whether or not Innovis really was the Jheiyah, and if the lord had truly been struck down by mortal hand.�css
    Broadly summarizing the most important and universally-accepted teachings and commandments of Salvatorism, the religion teaches the following basic commandments: one must accept and actively acknowledge the existence of the Salvatorist god, one must habitually praise and worship the god, one must not blaspheme, and that one must not resist the various other teachings and commands listed in the Great Gospel.  Different denominations have different ways of interpreting these basic principles, and some may include caveats or extra rules, such as adding animal sacrifice as a necessary practice or requiring the worship of various prophets alongside Jheiyah, most commonly Innovis, who is seen by the majority of denominations as an entity both separate and somehow the same as their god.�css
    The creation story of the universe defined by the Great Gospel states that there is a god who is not bound by time, space, nor dimension who spoke the universe into existence and formed the world ([!1 Itascus]) with the power of his command, materializing mud and rock for the ground, making a fire for the sun, and vast stone for the mountain ranges.  As he worked, the sweat of their labor to form the vast oceans of Itascus, a testament to the great care they put into creating a world for his flock to inhabit.  It is said that Jheiyah, after having created the universe and the [!4 Sol system], then decided to bring animacy to the mix by attempting to draft various creatures in hopes of creating the perfect host for intelligence, failing numerous times and creating a plethora of species before finally settling on the Itascan human species -- some clashes between the denominations can be found here.  According to the Great Gospel, the deity made life solely for Itascus, as it was God's special planet, and left the stars of the galaxy barren, only meant to be viewed as decorations in the night sky.  When the Itascans first encountered extraterrestrial sapients, the Salvatorists were shocked, and discussion arose to settle what this meant.  Many Salvatorists claimed that, perhaps, their god had simply kept alien life a secret for some specific purpose; the majority believes that aliens are simply early, imperfect drafts of [!5 Itascan humans], experiments made by God to perfect their fleshwork.  Some believe that, to to Jheiyah, these other species of human are equal in importance to Itascan humans, while others take on a more xenophobic stance, asserting that alien life consists of cosmic mistakes, akin to animals which God chose to hide from Itascan eyes.

pages.name: Talhov Brains
pages.data:
css
    A Talhov Brain, also known by some as a "Chesk Brain", is a type of self-teaching Artificial Intelligence built on a [!1 Talhov Framework].  Talhov Brains are most often used for autonomous movement of robotic systems, visual and audio recognition, and general-purpose human-oriented intelligence.  A Talhov Brain is the most plastic and general-purpose artificial intelligence known to the [!2 GCP], but conversely, it is also incredibly spontanous and unreliable.  While Talhov Brains are commonly used for human-like intelligences, they typically underperform biological humans in social settings, and are seen as unintelligent.  However, the speed at which Talhov Brains solve problems (whether the solution is correct or not) is typically considerably faster than that of most humans.  Socially-oriented Talhov Brains are known to have simple emotions, identical to most human emotions and moods (due to the AIs having been trained on real-world people).
    
    Talhov Brains are most commonly used for small autonomous robots, personal companions, and chatbots.  However, they are rarely used for automating devices or systems, especially not heavy machinery with little margin for error -- Talhov Brains, being built on the Talhov Framework, are notably spontanous and curious, meaning they will experiment and "play" with any hardware they are at the helm of, which can be very risky if the AI is placed in a position of responsibility or operation of dangerous hardware, such as industrial machinery, weaponry, or motor vehicles and spacecraft.�css
    This system was developed in the year 92 by a [!3 Tuine] scientist named Chesk Talhov, a computer hardware engineer with paranoid schizophrenia.  Chesk had set out using random number generation and artificial intelligence in an attempt to talk directly to God.  In order to collect the massive amount of data on spoken language he needed, he created the website [!4 BT.CHATTERBOX], which was a website where people could connect and "Talk to an AI" over voice or text.  The website became very popular across the galactic internet, gaining hundreds of thousands of unique visitors.  The site remained up for a period of one [!5 galactic year], over which the AI became noticably more humanlike in is conversational abilities and speech recognition (though still distinctly unhuman).  During this time, Chesk was still refining the Talhov Framework, off of which all Talhov Brains are built.  He also released many small, online games, also made to gather data to train AI.  After this period, the Chatter service went offline, with the front page of the website only showing a note thanking all of the site's users for their continued support.�css
    After Chatterbox went offline, Chesk Talhov had all the data he needed, and created a Nodule for his framework that talked and thought like a low-intelligence human.  Talhov released this framework, and the nodule, for free online, and it was quickly adopted by many programmers and hacker groups.  Within weeks, hundreds of thousands of instances of Talhov Brains were being used by hundreds of unconnected hacker groups to commit cyber crimes.  The majority of these crimes were in the form of automated scams, costing an estimated total of $1,400,000,000 in losses in the year 93.  Due to the unprecidented nature and scale of the scams, state governments assumed it was done by a previously-unknown organized crime syndicate.  The scam software was traced back to Chesk Talhov, and he was arrested by [!3 Tuine] state police within 10 days of posting the Talhov Framework.  He was cleared of his suspicion of committing the above crimes, but he remained in custody of the state, where he still is to this day.  Many suspect that he is currently secretively working for the Tuine state government.  However, this theory unconfirmed and unsubstantiated.

pages.name: Talhov Framework
pages.data:
css
    The Talhov Framework is an AI Framework based of [!1 CNM] technology.  AIs built with the Talhov Framework are self-learning, curious intelligences with human-like problem solving.  The Talhov Framework was invented in the year 93 by Chesk Talhov.  The Talhov Framework achieves its self-learning capabilities through constantly reprogramming itself in a manner similar to how organic neuron bundles in biological brains do.  Due to the manner of their creation, Talhov Framework AIs have "emotions" or "moods", which assist with decision making.  Due to being trained on mostly human-generated and human-oriented data, these emotions mirror human ones, including joy, anger, sadness, and even fear.  Though, many insist these emotions are surface-level and ungenuine.
    
    Talhov Framework AIs are very "Curious", and have a sufficient understanding of cause and effect, commonly trying new outputs and observing how they effect the environment around them.  This trait of curiously helps the AI quickly learn and absorb new information.  Talhov Frameworks are sold and distubuted in configurations called "images".  An image is a perfect copy of a framework, and can be put onto different machines -- essentially clones of the AI.  Each image contains every memory, tendency, and skill of a Talhov Brain.�css
    The framework is made to be modular, allowing for the integration of pre-made modules called "Nodules".  Nodules allow for support for things like human language conversation, understandings of physics, image recognition, and so on.  In order for a nodule to be added to a Talhov Framework, it must be "Integrated", which is a complicated process that requires a lot of time and/or processing power, in which the neurons of the system are randomly cut, reconnected, and checked until they are bruteforced into a connection with the neurons of the nodule.  Due to the random nature of integration, the process is destructive -- integration often has unintended effects on unrelated logic in the framework.  To get around this, most distributors make thousands of images of the framework before integration and performing integration on each.  After integrating each image individually, the image that exhibits the fewest unintended issues is chosen and distributed.

pages.name: Chatter Nodule
pages.data:
css
    The Chatter Nodule is a Talhov Framework module made by Chesk Talhov using data collected from the [!1 Chatterbox website].  The Chatter Nodule allows Talhov Framework AIs to speak in [! Unil] in a human-like manner.
    There are also variants made by 3rd parties which are slightly altered from the Chatter Nodule that allow the AI to speak other languages.  Despite this, the more reliable method of getting a Talhov Brain to speak a new language has been teaching it other languages manually, essentially reprogramming the Chatter Nodule through learning.

pages.name: PWAS Nodule
pages.data:
css
    The PWAS Nodule is a Talhov Framework module which allowes Talhov Brain AIs to have an inherent understanding of physics and have an internal physical worldmodel, both of which can be used in decision making.  "PWAS" stands for "Physical Worldmodel Awareness System", and was invented by graduate students at the [!1 Ceiraz Academy of Engineers] on [!2 Deoria].  This nodule is essential for AIs within autonomous real-world robots, and is best used with a Vision Nodule and tactile sensory components.

pages.name: Vision Nodule
pages.data:
css
    The Vision Nodule is a nodule made by Chesk Talhov to allow Talhov Brains to convert raw visual data into meaningful information in a process known as "image recognition".  With this nodule, an AI can take raw visual data, like from a camera, an determine what objects are in the frame, as well as information like how far they are.  Having a nodule such as this to easily digest visual data is very useful for autonomous systems, especially when used in robots in combination with a PWAS nodule.

pages.name: Deorian Food
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Deorian Meat Pies

pages.name: Deorian Meat Pies
pages.data:
css
┌──────────────────────────────────────┐
│Planet of Origin.: Deoria             │
│Time Period......: Ancient-Present    │
│Ingredients......: Smoked meat,       │
│                   berries, gravy,    │
│                   flour, lard, water,│
│                   various seasonings │
│Preparation Needs: Heat               │
└──────────────────────────────────────┘

    Deorian meat pie refers to a variety of savory, meat-filled pies and tarts originating from the [!1 Deorian] continent of Ricefield near the Ceiraz Mountain Range which has spread across the planet through time and migration.  In general, a typical, traditional pie from [!1 Ceiraz] will consist of a pie crust filled with a mixture of smoked [!2 Isfe] meat, gravy made from the rabbit`s drippings, and wild berries, well-seasoned and covered with another decorative layer of pie dough.  The dish is sweet and savory, and is notably rich and even somewhat creamy, thanks to the inclusion of the aforementioned gravy in the filling.  The crust, being made from a combination of [!3 Deorian wheat] flour, Isfe lard, and hot water, is normally a little dense and greasy, but still adequately flaky.  Deorian meat pies are popular all over the [!4 Silver Stream] in the modern era, most notably within [!1 Deorian] space and in [!5 Ghillymede].�css
    To our current understanding, the meat pies, as described, were historically reserved for important individuals such as leaders, priests, nobles, and foreign envoys, and were usually only eaten on special occasions, such as during the [!6 Ceiraz Lunar Festival] or birthdays of important individuals.  Commoners would have instead consumed a simpler dish of just the meat and berries, stewed together with coarse grains to form a rustic stew.  In the modern era, individuals from all stratums may be found consuming Deorian meat pies, with or without an occasion.  Deorian meat pies have become so greatly associated with [!7 Deorian culture] and culinary tradition that bakers must follow specific guidelines when making these pies in order to market them as “Deorian meat pie”, and even more rules and procedures in order to sell them as “[!8 Pacemist]-certified”.

    To prepare a traditional Ceiraz meat pie, one must first prepare a crust out of Deorian wheat flour, [!2 Isfe] lard, and hot water and set it aside.  A filling is then to be made out of a smoked Isfe, shredded into bits and mixed with Isfe gravy and a variety of wild berries which are to be dumped into the crust.  Another layer of crust is placed on top, which is, as previously mentioned, usually decorative.  Once the pie is assembled, it is cast into an oven until the crust begins to brown.  The pie is then drenched with a sweet-and-savory berry sauce and allowed to cool slightly before it is served in modest slices.�css
    Deorian meat pies have been made since Deoria’s ancient times, although they were then considered to be much closer to luxury festival food than a common meal.  Archeological evidence of pie-making on Deoria includes clay baking dishes and ornate clay tablets depicting certain round food items being served to ancient leaders.  The earliest written records of Deorian meat pies date back to around Deoria`s Bronze Age, where a Ceiraz priestess writes:
    "There is a foreign diplomatic progression standing before our city`s walls.  Among them stands their leader: a bold man who wears the antlers of his rivals and the teeth of his prey.  He has come to request a pact with our nation, as his warrior clan is in decline and requires some form of support.  As a sign of goodwill and future benevolence, we have sent them a congregation bearing artful pies of smoke-cured meat and sweet mountain berries."

    As better agricultural technology was developed and as many Deorians began to move away from [!8 Pacemistic] values, the making of Deorian meat pies was made significantly easier and the dish began to be eaten by all social classes within a short period after Deoria`s Industrial Revolution, regardless of the occasion.  The pie would eventually diffuse into the cuisines of other nations, eventually leading to its current interstellar popularity.

pages.name: SodaPop
pages.data:
css
┌───────────────────────────────┐
│Time Period.....: 98-Present   │
│Web Address.....: EQ.ZHB       │
│Type............: Video Sharing│
│Hosting Location: Deoria,      │
│                  decentralized│
│Web Layer.......: Surface      │
│Demographic Area: Silver Stream│
│Daily Users.....: 1.63 billion │
│Registered Users: 10 billion   │ 
└───────────────────────────────┘

    SodaPop (sometimes stylized as "ZhodaBop"), also known as “ZhdeejxBwa” in [!1 Deorian] by the [!2 GCP]`s Deorian-speaking demographic, is a Deorian video sharing platform, utilized primarily for the publication of video clips, such as vlogs, newsreels, presentations, entertainment content, and animations.  SodaPop is currently the most popular and diverse video sharing site within the GCP, and is used by millions of users daily.

    SodaPop was originally created by Moonflower Forest the Red, a [!3 Ceiraz Deorian] who was a university student at the [!4 Ceiraz Academy of Engineers] at the time, in the year 90 as a project for her computer science class.  Originally, the site only permitted short videos and had exclusively one server based in her university dorm room, but it quickly gained popularity throughout her campus and was soon being used as the go-to website to check in on the business of students and staff.  Eventually, this popularity leaked outside of the campus, and within a few years, it became evident that the site needed a proper launch and better servers.  Thus, in 91 P.W., Red officially launched a more refined version of the site and set up several servers across [!5 Ricefield], additionally founding a company under the same name as the site.�css
    By 93 P.W., almost all of Deoria had access to SodaPop, and once again, its popularity began to spread further than its sphere of influence: in 94 P.W., [!6 Itascus City], [!7 Itascus] became the first non-Deorian server host for SodaPop.  Initially, SodaPop`s success on Itascus was severely hindered by the lack of professional localization on the platform.  Thus, shortly after being introduced to Itascus, the site was properly translated into [!8 Unil] and several other major Itascan languages.  In 95 P.W., SodaPop was launched on [!9 Gallea] and [!10 Armalai], followed by [!11 La`foy] soon after, naturally being translated into those nations` respective languages as well.

    As of the current day, SodaPop`s services are available on most inhabited planets.  [!12 Neo Urra] is the only nation which does not host any SodaPop servers, as the site is banned by the Neo Urran government.

pages.name: Untitled
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Antler Regrowth Disorder

pages.name: Antler Regrowth Disorder
pages.data:
css
┌──────────────────────────────────┐
│Disease Type........: Genetic     │
│Transmission Type...: Genetic     │
│Contraction Chance..: 1 in 10,000 │
│Pan-Special?........: No          │
│Onset Time..........: N/A         │
│Symptoms & Effects..: Antlers do  │
│                      not regrow  │
│                      when severed│
│                      or damaged  │
│Illness Duration....: Chronic     │
│Fatality Rate.......: N/A         │
│Fatality Onset......: N/A         │
│Fatality Cause......: N/A         │
└──────────────────────────────────┘

    Antler Regrowth Dysfunction (or ARD) is a genetic disorder found exclusively in [!1 Deorians] and [!2 Furstian Deorians].  It prohibits the antlers of the affected from regrowing at any point after the completion of their initial grow-in.  The disorder is not inherently threatening to one`s life or health, but may result in social confusion due to the significance of one`s rack in nonverbal communication across Deorian cultures.

    The disease appears to be caused by a certain mutation in one Deorian chromosome responsible for facilitating antler growth.  Essentially, the mutation disables the body from directing the sending of the nutrients necessary for antler growth to the antlers after they first grow in, thus preventing further growth.  As a side note, researchers have noted a positive correlation between Deorian-Furstian interbreeding and their offsprings` chance of acquiring ARD; [!2 Zgorians] are at an elevated risk of being born with the mutation which causes antler regrowth dysfunction.�css
    As of now, there are currently no reliable treatment methods for this condition.  [!3 Transition Genetics] has been experimenting with ways to prevent the acquisition of the disorder for the last few decades, and had seen some success with [!4 Servuses], whose first generations were never observed to have had the culprit mutation.  However, it should be noted that over just a couple generations of Servuses, the mutation began to make a return at an exponential rate, implying that the artificial trait of guaranteed resilience against ARD is likely uninheritable or even undesirable.

pages.name: Neo-Urran Government Structure
pages.data:
css
    Neo Urra follows a [!1 Karminist] one-party system with presidential elections every 5 [!2 silver years] with no term limits.  Since its foundation, [!3 Celtai Tavekim] has been the only president of the young nation.  This system is Inherited from the old Urran Empire since Neo Urra doesn’t recognise itself as a distinct entity from the Urran Empire (Referring to the nation as "Neo Urra" is mainly only used in the [!4 GCP], and the official name of the country still is “The Urran Empire”).

    The state is ruled by the “president of the Urran Empire”, who holds the executive power.  He also is the supreme commander of the Armed Forces and shares the legislative power with the “Urran Senate” as the laws proposed by the president and his government are passed by default unless the senate vetoes it with a 60% majority.

    The judicial power is held by the “Urran Court Of Cassation”.  It is the final appeal in any judicial decision taken under the laws of Neo Urra.  The judges are appointed every 10 silver years by the president.

    In every election, The only allowed party is the Karminist Party, but it usually presents at least three candidates.  Most elections in Neo Urra are using a first past the post system where the incumbent’s (as in the candidate currently in the seat of power) number of votes is multiplied by 1.2 in order to account to the loss of popularity induced by any mandate.

pages.name: Celtai Tavekim
pages.data:
css
ep d css
┌───────────────────────────────────────────────────┐
│Full Name......: Celtai Tavekim                    │
│Relevant Titles: [!1 President of The Urran Empire]│
│Time of Birth..: 11/6/85                           │
│Place of Birth.: Celan, Kayan                      │
│Place of Living: [!2 Antaria, Kayan]               │
│Time of Death..: TBD                               │
│Cause of Death.: TBD                               │
│Place of Death.: TBD                               │
│Resting Place..: TBD                               │
│Species........: [!3 Tyvant]                       │
│Ethnicity......: Kayanese Tyventian                │
│Occupation(s)..: President of [!4 Neo urra]        │
│Languages......: [!5 Tyvansil], [!6 Unil]          │
│Top Net Worth..: N/A                               │
│Notable Assets.: None                              │
│Associates.....: [!7 Karmine Jacob]                │
└───────────────────────────────────────────────────┘

    Celtai Tavekim is the current head of state of the [!4 Neo urran empire] and the former prime minister under [!7 Karmine Jacobs].  He currently governs the nation from the Spire of [!2 Antaria].

    After an infancy in Celan, the former capital of [!8 Kayan], Celtai with his pro-regime family in 92 to the newly-founded city of [!2 Antaria] where he starts a curriculum in politics and interstellar geostrategy at the University of Antaria.  He is the valedictorian of his class of 150 and is quickly noticed for his intelligence and talent in politics, first by his professors and then by [!7 Karmine Jacobs] himself.  After the completion of his thesis on the equilibrium of power in the [!9 GUN] in 95, he starts a career in high administration and is quickly promoted to governor of Celesse in 99 and Prime Minister of the Urran Government in 100.�css
    In 102, during the [!10 Battle of Armalai], he was successfully evacuated from planetary Urra and came back to Kayan, he then became president in absentia as the designated survivor of Karmine Jacobs and was reelected in 104.  He has held the position ever since.

    Tavekim is part of a generation that replaced a lot of veterans from the coup when they retired and, having fully grown in an Imperial Urran environnement, is more loyal to the regime than the preceding generations.  His talent in politics combined with a very efficient propaganda service have made him very popular among the Neo Urran People.

pages.name: Socio-Economic Belief Paradigms
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Karminism

pages.name: Karminism
pages.data:
css
    Karminism a left wing ideology implemented by [!1 Karmine Jacobs] in the [!2 Urran Empire].  It is a social contract between the government and the governed where in exchange for the unwavering loyalty of the citizen to the state, the state makes sure that the citizen lives in comfortable conditions.

    One of the most prevalent effects of Karminism in The Urran Empire and Neo Urra is a basic income policy which takes up a significant amount of the government’s budget and makes sure that the citizens most basic needs like housing, food and clothing are met.  The citizen, in exchange must work for [!3 four silver years] for the government, either in the armed forces or in public works projects

    While today Neo Urra is poorer by capita than the rest of the [!4 GCP], defenders of Karminism argue that it is because of the quasi-total blockade enforced on the Urran Empire since its inception by most members of the GCP, which impeded economic growth until the economy adapted and focused in internal trade.

pages.name: Neo-Urran Military
pages.data:
css
    The Neo Urran military follows the 2 branches division which had been established in the Urran Empire.  The larger of the two is the Urran Imperial Fleet, which controls the military ships and space stations of Neo Urra.  The other is the Urran Imperial Army, which controls the Infantry, Artillery, Terrestrial Armor, Terrestrial Navy, Air Force and Coast Guard.

    The difference in funding stems from the assumption that, when the Imperial Army needs to Operate in a Theater of War, the orbit is either lost in a defensive scenario or under enemy control in an offensive scenario, and that the force which controls the orbit can strike anywhere on the planet at any time.  This makes the Imperial Fleet the most critical component of the military and shapes the doctrines of the army.

    The army has a large number of infantry trained in guerilla warfare and which is supposed to be able to operate independently if need be.  Neo Urra has a limited number of tanks because of their vulnerability to attacks from air and space and a small air force mainly based around helicopters, due to the assumption that airports and runways would be among the first targets of an invader.
    The number of soldiers, officers, and other workers in the army is believed to be between 100 and 300 million people.�css
    The Urran Army, notably, has a large number of missiles of varying payloads and operating ranges, from anti-armor missiles and MANPADS to large ground-to-space rockets designed to attack orbiting fleets, with both conventional and nuclear warheads.

    The Fleet relies on cost-effective, mass-produced small and medium ships with heavy firepower, high survivability, warp capability and long range -- ships such as the [!1 Armalai-Class Corvette].  The fleet is divided into battlegroups of approximately one thousand ships each, centered around a large capital ship.  An Urran Battlegroup can operate independently for extended periods of time.  [!2 GCP] experts estimate the number of active Urran battlegroups between 300 and 500.

pages.name: History of Gallean Royalty
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Gallean Royalty Post-World-War
    [!2] +Night of Melted Crowns [Unwritten]

pages.name: Broad History of Gallean Royalty Post-War
pages.data:
css
Background & Pre-War Societal Shifts:
    Gallean Royalty’s image sharply declined leading up to and during the [!1 Gallean World War].  While a few monarchies, principalities, and duchies governed in an enlightened and empathetic way, the majority were still ruled in a vastly absolutist manner.  The culture that had supported these hierarchies was steadily degrading; with the spread of [!2 Gearthmeiaism] among the servant and artisan classes, the 'divine right' of the rulers was diminishing. 

    The degrading social stability broke out into a few peaceful and violent revolutions, where multiple monarchies were overthrown and replaced by new governments following more socialist and collectivist ideals.  Ultimately, the [!1 Gallean World War] can be attributed to the surviving monarchies trying to maintain their status quo, anxious of societal upheaval destroying them, and the Revolutionary movements wishing to rid Gallea of its poisonous hierarchical past. 

    One part of the changing world that proved beneficial to these waning monarchies was Nationalism. Nationalism sprung up as a reactionary movement to the more Global, pan-Gallean ideals associated with the many flavors of Socialism.  While it was not inherently incompatible with [!2 Gearthmeiaism], it was in conflict with a few of its tenants.  There were a few Gearthmeist break-away sects that more attuned themselves with nationalism, but they were not as common as those which merely preferred to coexist.  Monarchies were able to weaponize nationalism to protect their rulerships, painting revolutionaries as trying to dilute and destroy their culture and history.   Nationalism would ever-further drive the divide between the monarchal and socialist ideologies, pushing any hopes of compromise into the dark.�css
Post-War:

    After the war’s devastating impact, many monarchies were reduced to ashes, with numerous casualties of royalty.  Those who survived were forced to flee into hiding or be tried.  The Crown Trials in -46, are criticized in modern days for biased judges and juries, resulting in many royal bloodlines being put to death.

    As the new Global government found its footing, from -46 to -40, many displaced royals were able to find metaphorical holes in the wall to hide in and form new lives.  Thanks to recent (at the time) books by descendants of these royals, it has been revealed that a secret society had formed between these survivors around -38.  The Royal Preservation Society (R.P.S.) would pool the resources and assets of the royals in hiding, providing fake documentation & identification, and even covering up incidents of royals exposing their cover.  R.P.S. was mostly outside of the Government’s notice, and only further faded into the obscurity as public opinions had shifted from toppling monarchs to a focus on issues with the current government. 

    While it would maintain a majority of the remaining royal population, R.P.S. would splinter over time.  One notable split off was the Rightful Rule faction in -2, their core ideology being that Royals should retake control of Gallea.  This faction achieved some success in local positions and a few attained military positions by 12.  Their less than subtle ideological ideals got them on the radar of the [!3 Gallean Bureau of Internal Threats] ("GBIT").  Subsequently, the Rightful Rule’s cells were crushed in simultaneous raids on the [!4 Night of the Melted Crowns].  It is speculated that a few members managed to escape and have reformed the Rightful Rule faction, but these rumors are thus far unsubstantiated.�css
     From the year 12 P.W. to the current day, most members of Royalty have stayed low as perceptions tempered and the generations moved on.  It is only recently that these bloodlines have come forward to lukewarm acceptance.  Most royals have integrated into modern Gallean society, following Gearthmeiaism and supporting the state.

    The R.P.S. itself now publicly funds historic preservation initiatives to protect what still survives of royal blood.  Its membership has opened up to the general public as of 101, with those inside the society publicizing many internal documents.  The result was a historian resurgence across Gallea, and more historical focus has begun on documentation of the world pre-revolution.

pages.name: Definition of Human
pages.data:
css
    In [!1 Unil], a "Human" is any living, organic creature capable of sapient thought and speaking or understanding a spoken or written language.

    Prior to the year 46 P.W., the word "Human", in Unil, had only referred to [!2 Itascan Humans].  This was problematic, as terms such as "Inhumane", "Humanity", and "Human Rights" would only implicitly apply to Itascans, as opposed to all species of Human.

    When Unil was standardized in 46, the term "Human" was expanded to include all sapient life forms known to the [!3 GCP].

    The Foundry Materiel Rifle - 93 or FMR-93 is the latest anti-materiel rifle produced by the [!1 Heralius Weapon Foundry Co.].  A 1524mm-long weapon, the FMR-93 comes factory-new with a bipod, muzzle flash diffuser, full stock, and a telescopic sight.  The weapon is designed for Gallean use and as such only had 3 finger holes in the grip.  The weapon`s self-loading mechanism is gas-operated. 

    The rifle normally uses 15.3mm FMJ rounds, notable special ammo in current use includes DuR (Depleted Uranium), Subsonic, High velocity, and High-Explosive.  All of which are produced exclusively by the [!2 Gallean Military].  The FMR-93 sells at $8,200 from HWF directly. 

    The FMR-93 is the main anti-material rifle used by the Gallean Military and is the latest in a long line of FMR rifles dating back to the days of the [!3 Gallean World War]. 

Special Information:
    Designed to meet [!4 Gallean]-versus-Gallean requirements, one well-placed shot can kill or maim any known species of [!5 human].
    The rifle has an effective range of 8 kilometers.

css
   [!1] +The Senatorial Guard [Stub]

pages.name: The Deorian Senatorial Guard
pages.data:
css
   The Deorian Senatorial Guard is a Deorian government organization tasked with the protection of Deorian government officials and foreign envoys, a job which had been previously tasked to state or municipal police and militia forces. It was founded in the year 87, following [!1 a non-lethal attack] on the current [!2 Deorian oversenator], Oversenator Painted Forest, by a group of Deorian-born [!3 Itascan] nationalists.

pages.name: Omelet
pages.data:
css
┌────────────────────────────────┐
│Planet of Origin.: [!1 Itascus] │
│Time Period......: -140-Present │
│Ingredients......: Eggs, milk,  │
│                   cheese, meat,│
│                   vegetables,  │
│                   butter/lard  │
│Preparation Needs: Heat, Skillet│
│                   or Pan       │
└────────────────────────────────┘

    An omelet, specifically the Ferikan omelet, is a savory egg-based dish originating from the Greater Coxville region of [!1 Ferika, Itascus], typically consumed as breakfast fare but also popular for other mealtimes and as street food.  Omelets conventionally consist of beaten eggs which are seasoned and cooked flat on a greased skillet until almost cooked, after which, fillings, almost always including at least cheese, are placed upon the egg and the egg is folded over, forming the omelet; the egg should be made to remain creamy in the center of the omelet and soft on the exterior.  The dish has many variations, the aforementioned merely being the most common and simple configuration of the dish.  Modern omelets are evidently descended from several egg dishes introduced by the people of [!1 Kullmia] to Ferika in Itascus’ Late Middle Ages.�css
    Eggs have been eaten on Itascus by many civilizations for several millennia, but the modern iteration of omelets has only been around for a few centuries.  The earliest written record of omelets as currently known can be found in an untitled cookbook which belonged to a cook who served the Duchy of Coxville’s royal family back in the -140s in which she describes “fried eggs like a concise journal with pages of cheese”, accompanied by a vague recipe for the aforementioned “egg-books”.Earlier records of omelets describe only prototypes of the modern dish, each usually missing some component or step of the process used today or utilizing completely different methods altogether.  One notable sister dish of the omelet is the torte, also known as the Kullmian pancake or “dol” in West Kullmian (which is actually a loanword from [!2 Unil]; the native word has been lost) which is prepared by mixing eggs with the fillings and then cooking them all together into a pancake, which is sometimes either folded over or rolled up once complete.  Tortes are commonly served with vinegar mixed with spices as a dipping sauce and are more often than not seen being served as street food throughout Kullmia and within Kullmian enclaves.�css
    In the year 87 P.W., while Oversenator Painted Forest was giving a short speech at a charity event in the town of Eastern Fields, Ricefield, [!3 Deoria], a small group of Deorian-born [!4 Itascan] nationalists emerged from the crowd and attacked the oversenator with a barrage of cold, cheese-stuffed omelets before fleeing back into the bewildered congregation.  There was one injury and one casualty reported: one event attendee stumbled and fell when a nationalist rushed past him, hitting his head on the pavement and obtaining a concussion, while another, albeit elderly, attendee thought that the president had been assassinated and suffered a cardiac arrest.  The perpetrators were quickly caught and tried for the endangerment of a government official and for being the indirect cause of the aforementioned injury and death.  The court ruled guilty on all charges except for that of manslaughter and the group was sentenced to 4 [!5 Silver Years] in prison.  As a result of the incident, many have begun to associate cheese omelets with Itascan nationalism, and the slang term “omelet-slinger” has arisen in [!2 Unil] as a term for a speciesist, especially one who is speciesist specifically against [!6 Deorians].  Additionally, the incident sparked the formation of [! The Senatorial Guard], which would assume the role of ensuring the protection of Deorian government officials and visiting foreign officials, a task which was previously only handled by local and/or state authorities.

    The etymology of “omelet” was rather difficult to pin down, primarily due to the bias of various linguists.  The current most accepted origin of the word is that it came from a now-dead Kullmian language isolate, which may also possibly explain why the other languages of Kullmia lack a modern word for the dish.  Alternatively, some suggest that the word is, in fact, native to Ferika, perhaps from Old Central Ferikan, “cumarad”, meaning “eggs”.

pages.name: Evolutionary History
pages.data:
css
    The Galleate species is a varied mix of multiple ancestors, eventually combining and evolving to form the Modern Galleate in all its variations.  This article is meant to provide a basic overview of the recent evolutionary history within the last 100 million years, and will have some generalizations and summarizations that may overlook many of the minutiae.

    The most distant ancestor of the modern Galleate, which still bore some resemblance, is the pack hunting/grazing omnivore, Vagari-Galleaten.  The Vagari traveled in nomadic packs.  Due to the sparse biosphere of [!1 Gallea], their diet was made up of any biomass they could find.  Their social connections were primarily familial in nature, with a Social Hierarchy based on age.  Their posture was quadrupedal, with no discernable bias between their front or back appendages.  One of their key strengths was endurance, not specializing in speed or raw strength, allowing them to trail another animal for long distances or survive from one patch of vegetation to the next.  Their protection from the freezing cold of Gallea was provided by blubber and a thick coat of fur.�css
    The subsequent important link in the chain of ancestors was Fodiendi-Galleaten.  The social structures grew complex as more than one family of Fodiendi would form herds.  With this increased population, the need for temporary burrows arose.  The front legs of the Vagari had grown larger, and the claws at the paws had become larger and more emphasized, specializing into arms.  These claws were efficient at carving burrows, especially when work was done in a team.  The claws also proved useful in hunting.  In conjunction with retaining the endurance of the Vagari, the Fodiendi were capable hunters; the extra bulk had shifted the body's center of mass forward with a more extended spine, widened shoulder area, and longer forearms.  These changes coincided with a hybrid posture; Fodiendi would balance on their hind legs while digging, but for the most part stayed quadrupedal. 

    The now closest ancestor species to the modern Galleate was the Tribrectus-Galleaten.  Commonly nicknamed the ‘Early Galleat’; these most strongly resemble the modern Galleates out of all previously discussed specimens.  This species had begun using tools, and their social structures were almost tribal or clan-like.  Due to their use of tools, the physical buildup of the Fodiendi in the fore section decreased in the Tribrectus but was still fairly noticeable with long arms and wider shoulders.  One very important development was the bi-pedal posture, while not as straight as a modern Galleate, the Tribrectus’ bi-pedal stance allowed its forearms and claws to evolve into nimble manipulators.  Comprised of 4 digits -- three main digits, and an opposable thumb -- the hands allowed for precision.  The claws once used extensively for digging had grown duller and less prominent, which made them more general-purpose.

pages.name: Bodges
pages.data:
css
┌─────────────────────────────────┐
│Planet of Origin.: Itascus       │
│Time Period......: -50s-Present  │
│Ingredients......: Flour, Eggs,  │
│                   Sugar, Butter,│
│                   Yeast, Oil or │
│                   Lard          │
│Preparation Needs: Proofing, Heat│
└─────────────────────────────────┘

    A boadge, sometimes spelled as “boage” or “boge”, is a type of sweet, rich, yeast-leavened fritter originating from [!1 Ferika, Itascus].  Traditionally, boadges were only prepared and consumed during certain holidays and festivals, but have also commonly been eaten for breakfast, dessert, and with coffee within many cultures on Itascus since around the year -10 P.W..  Boadges are popular across the [!2 Silver Stream], and are considered quintessential café fare.  A person who specializes in making boadges, or similar fried pastries, is referred to as a “boadger” (or “boadgeress”), and a venue that primarily produces boadges is called a “boadgery”.

    Prior to Itascus’ age of global industrialization, boadges were solely eaten in celebration of certain Ferikan holidays, such as [!3 Innovillion/Gail] and [!4 Yvest], especially by those of the upper class.  When the mass-production of food and foodstuffs became widespread, and Itascan cultures further diffused across Itascus, boadges gradually started becoming increasingly common outside of celebratory contexts, though they are still consumed in far greater quantities during holidays.�css

    Simple boadges consist of just five ingredients: flour, eggs, sugar, butter, and a yeast leavener, which is conventionally sourdough starter, but often substituted with baker’s yeast.  The flour, eggs, sugar, and yeast are mixed together to form a dough, after which butter is slowly incorporated by flattening the dough out, spreading a layer of butter upon the dough’s surface, and folding the dough over itself, then continuously laminating the dough until multiple layers of butter have been formed.  The dough is allowed to rest and rise before it is divided into the cook’s preferred shapes and fried in hot cooking oil or lard until golden brown and cooked through.  Once cooked, they are often finished with a layer of glaze or sugar.  The end result is a soft, very sweet fritter with distinct layers as a result of the butter on the inside.

    The earliest references to boadges date back to just before Itascus’ era of widespread industrialization, and are referred to as “butter fritters” or “sugar fritters” in many documents.  The term “boadge” arose much later and is of a somewhat enigmatic origin.  Some Unil linguists suggest that it is a comical contraction between the words “boat” and “barge”, alluding to how the fritters float in the cooking grease.  Others argue that it is a corruption of the word “bulge”, citing the East Ferikan street cant’s pronunciation of the word.  Notwithstanding, the modern formal spelling of the word was likely influenced by the spellings of words like “boat” and “road”.

pages.name: Untitled
pages.data: [Unwritten]

pages.name: Games & Recreation Companies
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Digiglade VR

pages.name: Digiglade VR
pages.data:
css
┌────────────────────────────────────┐
│Time Period.....: 103-Present       │
│Web Address.....: [!1 IT.DIGIGLADE] │
│Type............: Game Platform     │
│Hosting Location: Decentralized     │
│Demographic Area: [!2 Silver Stream]│
│Daily Users.....: ~121 Million      │
│Registered Users: ~3.2 Billion      │
│Open Stocks?....: Yes               │
│Net Worth.......: $39.8 Billion     │
└────────────────────────────────────┘

    Digiglade VR is a free-to-play, online [!3 Virtual Reality] Game Making and Hosting Platform, which sees, on average, around 121,000,000 daily active users.  Digiglade provides tools for its users to create and market games and experiences built on the "Digiglade Experience Engine", also called the 'DEE'.  The name "Digiglade" is a contraction of "Digital Glade".
    While being oriented towards VR Users, Digiglade also allows non-VR users, referred to as "desktop" users, to access its services, though to a much more limited degree, with the experience being similar to traditional first-person computer games.  However, due to their fundamentally-different and comparatively-limited medium of interaction with digital environments, Desktop Users are often stigmatized, and even forbidden from some (typically more competitive) experiences.  Despite not being the target audience, Desktop Users make up the majority of Digiglade`s userbase.

    Digiglade makes use of its own virtual fiat currency called "DigiBucks".  DigiBucks foster a dynamic online market among Digiglade users, with the company mediating and taxing exchanges of digital goods and services. Digiglade also allows users to directly transfer Digibucks between eachother for a small fee.  DigiBucks were introduced in 102 to allow the company to monetize the platform, which directly led to a share value increase of 368% the following year.�css
    DigiBucks can be purchased from Digiglade at a rate of 10 DigiBucks per $1 [!4 ITC].  After 107, Digiglade began allowing users to sell DigiBucks back to the company at a rate of $1 per 50 Digibucks (with a minimum quantity of 50,000 digibucks), giving them a definite real-world value.  As well as for having a steep exchange rate favoring Digiglade, the company has recently come under criticism from many news outlets, and even some planetary governments, as it came apparent that DigiBucks were being used in some illegal, or otherwise unethical, interjurisdictional exchanges.  In response, the company stated they would internally monitor for suspicious exchanges in their own systems to mitigate misuse of the digital currency.  As to if they have effectively reduced cybercrime involving Digibucks is yet to be seen.
    
    The company was initially founded in 103, being a desktop game platform based on users creating original games using the Digiglade Experience Engine.  The company saw some small success, with its userbase being local to Itascus.  In 104, Digiglade formed a partnership with the NetGate Hardware company, in which Digiglade made its platform accessible to the NetGate-manufactured Ingress VR Headset, and advertise the hardware on their website.  In exchange, Digiglade was given a portion of all headset sales for the duration of the agreement.  The partnership was a success, with a steep increase in both Ingress Headset sales and Digiglade Experience Engine downloads.  This partnership is ofted single-handedly credited with kicking-off [!3 the second wave of VR Enthusiasm], finally bringing recreational VR into popular culture.�css
    Shortly after the NetGate deal, Digiglade as a company pivoted to be VR-oriented, officially renaming itself to "Digiglade VR", and making further partnerships with NetGate, as well as various other, smaller hardware companies.  In 107, Digiglade purchased NetGate as a subsidiary, and now sells the Ingress VR Headset at a loss.  With each purchase of an Ingress headset, the customer recieves a voucher for 500 Digibucks, and a data volume containing an installer for the Digiglade Experience Engine.  While each headset sale loses money for the company, it's believed Digiglade is able to still turn a profit through DigiBucks sales from those who had bought a headset unit and subsequently installed Digiglade.

    Digiglade's content-base is extensive; in 107, Digiglade VR revealed in their devblog that around 70 million unique Digiglade Experience Engine Simulations (called simply "Experiences" on the platform) had been uploaded to their servers by their users.  This number is thought to have quadrupled in the time since it was quoted.  Many experiences are very popular, with some experiences having been known to have up to 500,000 peak concurrent players.  Some popular experiences have their own communities and cultures, with many being culturally influential enough to be known of outside of the Digiglade platform.  Creation of experiences has been shown to be very profitable; the Digiglade developer environment has been known to foster many a small professional game studio (most of which being centered around purely-Digiglade-based game development).  In fact, Digiglade offers partnership programs for developers and development firms, which can offer special promotions and monetary bonuses for the experiences they build within Digiglade.  Some of the top 100 games companies in the [!2 Silver Stream] have made partnerships with Digiglade VR to bring multi-million dollar intellectual properties to the platform in the form of experiences.

pages.name: Virtual Reality
pages.data:
css
    [!1] +Main
    [!2] ~Digiglade

pages.name: Virtual Reality
pages.data:
css
    Virtual Reality is a blanket term for immersion within a virtual environment, or "reality", through use of specialized software, such as [!1 Digiglade], and specialized hardware such as body trackers and head-mounted displays.  Virtual Reality is used primarily for training simulations and recreation, being able to effectively place a person into any concievable scenario.
    
    Virtual Reality was first conceptualized in many cultures prior to the invention of [!2 Warp Drive], but wasn't fully realized until the year 98 upon the discovery of photo lithography, kicking off the first wave VR enthusiasm.  However, the first generation of VR hardware was error-ridden and prohbitively expensive, and was eventually dismissed as an expensive fad after the turn of the century.  However, in 106, companies such as [!1 Digiglade VR and NetGate] made VR reliable and affordable, kicking off the second wave of VR enthusiasm, planting recreational VR firmly in popular culture.

pages.name: Main
pages.data:
css
Manymoon is down, but not for long.
Starting today, our tongues are untied; we will no longer be censoring our users.
Individual threads will still have their own rules, but we will not be bound by laws and court orders intended to silence diverse thought.
No longer will Erii, nor any government, control our minds and dictate our words.

Stay tuned.
